story:
Aya in a Nutshell

  • Aya is committed to children, families and communities 
  • We are a merry band of do-gooders...mostly teachers 
  • We support families through literacy projects and service learning

"Making the simple complicated is commonplace; making the complicated simple, awesomely, simple is creative." Charles Mingus

Simply put, Aya seeks to provide the community access to a share space to...a space that provides opportunities for ART, STEM, HEALTH, and LITERATURE. With workshops to strengthen families on literacy, nutrition and finances and open hours to allow for autonomous learning play, our community classroom helps parents connect and reconnect with their children. And the best component is that our families will engage in community service every month to make their communities stronger.

In simplest terms, with the help of our supporters, WE WILL TURN OUTREACH INTO INREACH. 

Twist and Shout!

  • Aya is putting a new TWIST on how communities can care for themselves.  The $14,000 we raise will secure our classroom materials including a portable kitchen for our nutrition cooking class, art supplies and buckets full of Legos for our STEM classes.
  • We are ready to SHOUT out our supporters.  We will name our classes and classroom spaces after our supporters. 

Our first priority is raising literacy and critical thinking through STEM studies and if we fall below our $14,000 threshold, we will open our Literature Lounge and STEM studio first.  This will allow us to provide families with workshops and community service opportunities. 

 

Happy Endings

Our impact has already begun throughout the metro Atlanta area.  We support families through building the personal libraries of children, hosting youth STEM sessions and providing family workshops on literacy.  We  work collaboratively with local libraries, churches and museums to reach children and their families.  And with our supporters, our grassroots support will take deeper root.

Other Ways You Can Help

Join us in our simple purpose of making communities stronger by connecting families and encouraging community service. You can support us by

  • Sharing our work with friends via Facebook, Twitter or morse code.  All support is welcome.
  • Also, we welcome in kind donations. Books, Lego kits, yoga mats, and art supplies would help greatly.

story:
The Mission:

Our mission here at The Good Samaritan is to help people learn to better themselves by giving them an invaluable skill, the knowledge of the English language.

The Campaign:

 

We are raising $500 for this summer's Summer Camp in which we will combine classroom instruction in the English language followed by games such as baseball, volleyball, and gymnastics.  This is important because the students here will be more inclined to come to class because they know that they will also be having fun. 

About 67% of girls here in the Dominican Republic drop out of school according to UNESCO studies. Overall, this campaign is extremely important to the world because if we help more poeple to learn English here in the Dominican, we will be able to raise the standard of living and decrease the poverty level, as well as help the global economic conditions.

Knowing English, and knowing it well, is a first-class ticket to a good job here in the Dominican Republic due to the tourism industry.  The Good Samaritan is an outlet for these people because it allows them to continue learning, and gives them a safe envirionment.  Most of these kids don't have electricity when they return home, nor do they have a solid family structure supporting them.  By contributing to this campaign, you will be directly helping these kids and adults to make a better life for themselves and their families.  

 

What We Need:

  • Textbooks for all students ($250 RD each, which is about $6.25 US each; we will need about $100 for this, but maybe more due to the fact that more people attend summer camp)
  • Other School Supplies (Crayons, markers, paper, etc. $100 US)
  • Sports Equipment (baseballs, bases, volleyball, volleyball net, and gymnastics equipment--roughly $100 US)
  • First Aid Kits ($25 US)
  • Water
  • Miscellaneous Items (garbage bins, cups, etc., $50)

Unique Perks!!!

Because this is a non-profit organization, we're trying to be sustainable

  • See a Student:
    • For a $25 you will receive a picture of a student with some basic information about them
  • Thank-You Cards
    • For a $50 donation, you will receive a picture of a student with basic information, as well as a personalized thank-you card made by that student
  • Personalized Videos
    • For a $100 donation, you will receive a personalized video of a student which will include information about them and a thank-you message

If We Don't Reach Our Goal:

If we don't reach our goal of $500, we will still keep the money, and take the 9% hit on the flex funding option. 

 

The Impact

Some of these kids and adults literally have nothing.  They live in barrios which are not only lacking in clean water and electricity, but they can also be quite dangerous places to live.  As previously mentioned, about 67% of female students drop out of school.  According to dominicandream.org, the Domincan Republic's investment into public education is only 2.3% of their GDP (gross domestic product), which is ranked 122 out of 132 countries.  They were also ranked 101 out of 177 countries in terms of literacy, and only 12% of low-income students who start high school will complete their studies, compared to 62% of those from higher income brackets in the DR.

If you contribute to this campaign, you will directly be impacting the lives of these people by giving them a skill that cannot easily be taken away; knowledge.  Throughout the history of the world, we have seen that the only real way to better ourselves and our society is through education.  By helping these people to learn the English language, we will be helping to open doors to brighter future.  If they learn English, then they will be able to work in the tourism industry, and therefore increase their income and provide a better life for their family.  This in turn will also help the Dominican Republic's economy because if they know English, then tourism will increase.  If tourism increases, then the money spent here will increase, which will therefore increase the standard of living of the Dominican's. 

These students are very special people.  I have never met so many people who are so excited to learn.  Not only are they excited to learn English, but they are also excited to learn about us, the volunteers.  They are a very loving group of people and will gladly invite you into their homes for lunch or dinner.  I've never experienced such kindness, with nothing expected in return. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that's okay!  Money isn't the only way that you can help us out.  Just by spreading the word, you can dramatically make a difference because you probably know someone who is willing and able to donate. 

Just as a reminder, you can use the Indiegogo share tools.  Another good way to share this is via Facebook!  Thanks so much for your time!
story_txt:
The Mission:
Our mission here at The Good Samaritan is to help people learn to better themselves by giving them an invaluable skill, the knowledge of the English language.
The Campaign:
 
We are raising $500 for this summer's Summer Camp in which we will combine classroom instruction in the English language followed by games such as baseball, volleyball, and gymnastics.  This is important because the students here will be more inclined to come to class because they know that they will also be having fun. 
About 67% of girls here in the Dominican Republic drop out of school according to UNESCO studies. Overall, this campaign is extremely important to the world because if we help more poeple to learn English here in the Dominican, we will be able to raise the standard of living and decrease the poverty level, as well as help the global economic conditions.
Knowing English, and knowing it well, is a first-class ticket to a good job here in the Dominican Republic due to the tourism industry.  The Good Samaritan is an outlet for these people because it allows them to continue learning, and gives them a safe envirionment.  Most of these kids don't have electricity when they return home, nor do they have a solid family structure supporting them.  By contributing to this campaign, you will be directly helping these kids and adults to make a better life for themselves and their families.  
 

What We Need:

Textbooks for all students ($250 RD each, which is about $6.25 US each; we will need about $100 for this, but maybe more due to the fact that more people attend summer camp)
Other School Supplies (Crayons, markers, paper, etc. $100 US)
Sports Equipment (baseballs, bases, volleyball, volleyball net, and gymnastics equipment--roughly $100 US)
First Aid Kits ($25 US)
Water
Miscellaneous Items (garbage bins, cups, etc., $50)
Unique Perks!!!
Because this is a non-profit organization, we're trying to be sustainable

See a Student:

For a $25 you will receive a picture of a student with some basic information about them


Thank-You Cards

For a $50 donation, you will receive a picture of a student with basic information, as well as a personalized thank-you card made by that student


Personalized Videos

For a $100 donation, you will receive a personalized video of a student which will include information about them and a thank-you message


If We Don't Reach Our Goal:
If we don't reach our goal of $500, we will still keep the money, and take the 9% hit on the flex funding option. 
 

The Impact
Some of these kids and adults literally have nothing.  They live in barrios which are not only lacking in clean water and electricity, but they can also be quite dangerous places to live.  As previously mentioned, about 67% of female students drop out of school.  According to dominicandream.org, the Domincan Republic's investment into public education is only 2.3% of their GDP (gross domestic product), which is ranked 122 out of 132 countries.  They were also ranked 101 out of 177 countries in terms of literacy, and only 12% of low-income students who start high school will complete their studies, compared to 62% of those from higher income brackets in the DR.
If you contribute to this campaign, you will directly be impacting the lives of these people by giving them a skill that cannot easily be taken away; knowledge.  Throughout the history of the world, we have seen that the only real way to better ourselves and our society is through education.  By helping these people to learn the English language, we will be helping to open doors to brighter future.  If they learn English, then they will be able to work in the tourism industry, and therefore increase their income and provide a better life for their family.  This in turn will also help the Dominican Republic's economy because if they know English, then tourism will increase.  If tourism increases, then the money spent here will increase, which will therefore increase the standard of living of the Dominican's. 
These students are very special people.  I have never met so many people who are so excited to learn.  Not only are they excited to learn English, but they are also excited to learn about us, the volunteers.  They are a very loving group of people and will gladly invite you into their homes for lunch or dinner.  I've never experienced such kindness, with nothing expected in return. 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, that's okay!  Money isn't the only way that you can help us out.  Just by spreading the word, you can dramatically make a difference because you probably know someone who is willing and able to donate. 
Just as a reminder, you can use the Indiegogo share tools.  Another good way to share this is via Facebook!  Thanks so much for your time!

story:
Help us send the Phoenix Leadership Team youth to The 25th National Conference on LGBT Equality: Creating Change in Atlanta, Georgia, January 23–27, 2013. 

The Creating Change Conference

Creating Change is the premier annual organizing and skills-building event for the lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender community and their allies.

The conference is run by the National Gay and Lesbian Task Force, and attracts more than 3,500 people from all over the country every year. Presenters and participants come from all walks of life and include members of the business community, elected officials, students, faith leaders and staff and volunteers of non-profit organizations.

The Phoenix Leadership Team

The Phoenix Leadership Team (PLT) is EQUAL’s Youth Advisory Board. Every year the top applicants are picked from all over the Kansas City region to participate in this year-long intensive training. PLT members will be paired up with leaders representing a variety of aspects of social justice organizing. PLT members are in charge of organizing several EQUAL events and actions, including the EQUAL Empowerment Summit and the Day of Silence.

Help Support Kansas City's Queer and Allied Youth!

By making a contribution to this campaign you are changing these young people's lives. The experiences, networking opportunities and knowledge they will gain at this conference will give them skills that they will be able to draw on for the rest of their lives. The five-day program features over 350 workshops and training sessions, four plenary sessions, and tons of networking opportunities. By helping them get to this conference you will not only be supporting these young people but also be helping EQUAL lay a strong foundation of progressive activism in Kansas City and throughout the Midwest.

Where will my money go?

Each participant is working hard to individually raise $1000 to fund their portion of the trip. This money will go toward airfare, accommodations, and food for the Phoenix Leadership Team and the adult mentors to attend the conference. EQUAL is a registered 501c3 in Missouri that has a commitment to never turn away young people due to lack of funds. If we receive any money beyond the $10,000 for the Creating Change Conference it will support our programs to empower queer youth. Everyone who donates will receive a personalized postcard from the conference in Atlanta!

Other Ways To Help

We understand that not everyone has the money to make a donation right now. If you can't help fund us right now, please help by sharing this page through social media! We can't make it there without your help! EQUAL is always looking for volunteers so please emal support@equalcenter.org if you want to get more involved!

EQUAL

EQUAL is Kansas City’s for youth-by youth Gay Straight Alliance Network, connecting queer youth across the metropolitan area. EQUAL provides mentorship, activism and leadership trainings, peer groups, and organizes an annual Empowerment Summit, National Coming Out Day, Midwest QueerFest, and the Day of Silence.

EQUAL believes that young people of all gender identities and sexual orientations deserve access to the tools to be healthy, empowered members of their communities. EQUAL enables the next generation of social justice leaders dedicated to ending all forms of oppression.

story:
The Track and Field Athletes Association is proud to announce a partnership with the Bay Area Track Club's Bay Area Cross Challenge on January 13th, 2013, and is seeking donations and sponsorships for the BATC Kids Program, as we'll be hosting an event with the help of professional runners to promote the sport to the area youth, to be held in conjunction with the BAXC meet. The Bay Area Cross Challenge is a unique opportunity for runners of all ability levels to compete alongside professional distance runners on a cross country course in the heart of San Francisco. After the race, enjoy post-race food, prizes, and music as you meet and mingle with Olympians and world-class athletes.

For more information on the meet, please visit: http://www.bayareatrackclub.com/page/BAXC-2013.

For video footage of last year's race, highlighting the elite athletes involved, click here.

The BATC Kids Program is a new athletic program designed to get kids outside and active after school. With the help of the Bay Area Track Club (BATC) there are local Olympians and Olympic hopefuls to play, teach, and lead the kids each week. The program is open to all ages and skill levels and its mission is to inspire kids to develop a healthy body and mind. Kids will learn how exercise and practice can help all ages to improve skills such as speed, agility, coordination, strength, and flexibility, all while having plenty of fun.

We invite you to watch the video of the BATC Kids Program at the Yick Wo Elementary School, providing a glimpse in to the mission of the BATC Kids Program and the impact it has on area youth. We are looking to raise at least $10,000 for the event. Please consider making a donation, or please contact the TFAA's Marketing & Special Events Coordinator Jenny Scherer if you are interested in becoming a sponsor and/or matching donations coming in for the event.

Please help us get the word out about this campaign and event! Share our cause with family and friends, and why not join us on Sunday, January 13th? We hope to see you there!

story:
My Story

I am excited to start my first year teaching at High Tech Elementary in just a few short weeks! I am honored to be teaching the 3rd grade and since this is my very first year on my own I need to gather the supplies necessary so that my students will have a successful year. 

"Technology is nothing. What's important is that you have faith in people, that they're basically good and smart, and if you give them the tools they will do wonderful things with them." - Steve Jobs 


What We Need & What You Get

Your donations will help me gather the necessary tools that will help my students learn, grow, and succeed in the 3rd grade. What tools you ask? Well here are just a few examples of what I will use your donations for:

-Math manipulatives! Base ten blocks, clocks, calculators, number lines..

-Chart paper! To chart main ideas, elements of poems, identifying theme

-BOOKS! Can you say independent reading ;) Having a classroom library is the best way to empower children with a love for reading


The Impact

Not only will these supplies help my students this year...I will also use these supplies for years to come. That being said, your contributions will positively affect hundreds of children in my classroom!


Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate? No Worries! 

Help out by sharing this and give me a shout out! :)

story:
Short Summary

Rooted & Built Up (R&BU) is a Christian teaching conference based in Kingston, Jamaica. The R&BU conference is a unique initiative that unites Christians from different denominational backgrounds around deepening their understanding of the gospel.

We’re raising funds to offset the cost of staging our 2nd conference on October 3, 2015, under the theme “Abide”. Through preaching in general sessions and workshops we’ll be unfolding John 15:1-17. Our goal is that by the end of the day, conference participants would have a clear understanding of how to walk in obedience to Jesus’ commands in the passage, and a greater appreciation for their need to dig deeper into the good news that they first believed.

Your contributions will help us to successfully stage an excellently run one-day conference for 300 attendees in a comfortable setting at an affordable cost.


Conference Speakers

Mark Prater - Executive Director, Sovereign Grace Churches

Cedric Moss - Senior Pastor, Kingdom Life Church, Bahamas

Joel Bain - Founder, Rooted & Built Up

What We Need & What You Get

Base goal - $7300

We’ve already raised $3200 in cash and services within our R&BU support network, but we still need another $7300 to offset costs and bring this all together. The truth is, if we were to pass on the entire economic cost of putting on the conference, a lot of the people we’re targeting wouldn’t be able to afford the conference fee. With your help we’ll be able to keep the costs low for participants but still put on a quality event.

What you give will cover the cost of our venue, conference branding materials, packages for conference participants and volunteers, sound system rental, and honoraria for conference speakers.

First Stretch Goal - $8500

If we can raise $8500, we’ll be able to film the plenary sessions of the conference and make them available for free through our website (wouldn’t that be cool?!).

Second Stretch Goal - $11,000

At this level of funding we’d be able to offer lower conference fees to students, married couples and seniors, and offer scholarships to individuals who can’t afford the fee. C’mon!

Perks

We’ve put together a package of rewards that includes early access to conference audio, personal reflections on the conference from Joel Bain, the founder of Rooted & Built Up, Rooted & Built Up t-shirts (with our cool logo), and a very special Rooted & Built Up leather notebook!

The Impact

R&BU provides an unique avenue for contributing to the quality of disciples in Jamaica. The conference is a response to a deficit in our teaching and discipleship as we’ve come to take the gospel as a given rather than making it the object of our focus. Our vision is for R&BU to become a rallying point for those persuaded of the crucial value of gospel teaching for believers, through a biennial conference, web resources, and other smaller events between conferences. We need your help to continue offering the kind of teaching that provides a deeper understanding of what Christ has accomplished for us, leading to believers living lives that are worthy of our calling in Christ.

Our first conference was held in May 2013, and was facilitated by members of a Navigators (US/Canada) missions team and a number of Jamaican preachers and teachers. Approximately 100 attendees from 12 different churches worshiped together, engaged with expository preaching in plenary sessions, and participated in small group workshops. The feedback from attendees was exceedingly positive and very encouraging.

Risks & Challenges

If we don’t reach our entire goal of $7000 we will still make every effort to stage the conference - albeit a scaled back version. It would be far less than ideal, because it would mean cutting key areas of our budget that would impact the overall quality of the event as well as our ability to honour our speakers and volunteer staff.

Other Ways You Can Help

We need your help to get the word out!

  1. Pray for the conference - we still have a lot of work to do to put on a successful conference. Please pray for grace for the planning team and for the speakers as the prepare.

  2. Share the info with your friends and networks - use Indiegogo’s share tools to the left or email the info to friends. We need you to help us promote R&BU 2015 to anyone who can attend the conference and to anyone who could help to support us financially. We're praying that people who love Jesus and the gospel (whether or not they're connected with Jamaica) would be willing to help us in this gospel work.

story:
Short Summary

Hello!

Barrett is a 22-year-old English-Creative Writing major at the University Of Houston- ("Go Coogs!") who enjoys making grumpy cat faces more than the average person. 

Although he’s been the recipient of several scholarships, he works a fulltime job to help support his family with paying bills, the mortgage, food and gas… Which makes paying for school a little difficult, as FAFSA does not contribute much and he and his family have absolutely nothing in savings to contribute themselves.

What We Need & What You Get

Recently, he found out that the scholarships he’s received only covers part of his tuition, which means he needs $5,000 to continue his education this semester, which is an absurd amount of money to come up with for him. He believes that he has to withdraw from this semester, but we want to prove him wrong and surprise him with his tuition. 

The Impact

With your donation, we can give him the chance of being one step closer to finally obtaining his degree and pursuing his dream career. 

    Risks & Challenges

    Watch out, helping Barrett might mean a lot for him! He will be eternally grateful and wont know how to thank you. So, in order to help him thank you guys for your support, we have created some fun perks!

    For $1 that you donate, you will receive a virtual high five and a shout out. (Woo!)

    For $10 you will receive a virtual high five, hug, and a nice email. (Wow!)

    For $25 you will receive a personal thank you card along with a photo of Barrett making his best Grumpy Cat faces. Also, if you are a college student, Barrett will edit your tedious papers and hopefully earn you an A! (Sweet!)

    For $50 you will receive a video of him happy dancing, along with a personal message and some baked goodies. (Yum!)

    For $100 you will receive a post card, baked goodies and -wait for it- a calendar of 12 marvelous Grumpy Barrett photos that will have keep you excited through all of 2015!

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

      • Ask your friends to donate, all it takes is a copy and paste in your favorite social media site!

      Thank you so much for reading everything, you are the best! 


      Update #1: If you donate more than $10, please let us know your email and name when you make your donation, or if you have any questions feel free to email us at helpbarrettwhite@gmail.com so that we can give you your exclusive thank you card :D

story:
Update: Make a donation of any size between now and January 4th and you will automatically be entered into a raffle to win four New York Yankees Field Box Tickets.


Short Summary

Think back to your most memorable travel experience. Who did you travel with? Where did you visit? 

Regardless of purpose or destination; travel changes us. It forces us to step out of our comfort zone, experience diverse cultures, and most importantly learn about ourselves. Why should only some students have the opportunity to experience the positive benefits of travel?

Trip of a Lifetime aims to change the way students experience travel by providing summer travel scholarships and leadership development programs to deserving students that might never have the opportunity to travel otherwise. The organization needs your help this holiday season to make our vision a reality.

Here are some highlights of Trip of a Lifetime:

  • Provided scholarships for 44 underprivileged students
  • Completely student run and operated
  • Featured in the Wall Street Journal, NY Post, and Poughkeepsie Journal
  • Recognized by the New York City Department of Education 

Bria T, Briana T, Peaches W, and Selina A at Alcatraz, Summer 2014

What We Need & What You Get

  • This holiday season, we are asking for $5,000, enough to provide a full travel scholarship to one student. While this is a lot of money, remember that each student trip impacts an additional 25-50 students upon their return!
  • In return for your generosity, we have some great perks available including t-shirts, hoodies, and travel themed gift baskets, all designed by trip alumni themselves. 

Trip of a Lifetime founder Stan Rosenberg and Nouman I, Summer 2014 alumnus at a school visit in Brooklyn, NY

The Impact

  • Travel is more than a trip; it's a lifelong journey. Your gift will instill leadership, confidence, and hope in some of this generation's brightest students, enabling them to become catalysts for change in their communities.
  • Trip of a Lifetime is completely student run and operated. We have no overhead cost or full time staff so every dollar counts
  • Did You Know: 100% of all Trip of a Lifetime alumni are currently in college or are college bound
Don't just take it from us. Here are some testimonials from students that have traveled with our organization:

"This trip taught me that one man's trash is another person's treasure." - Jessica U, Summer 2013 Alumnus

"When I first stepped foot in California, it was eye-opening; I felt like Charlie when he enters Willy Wonka's chocolate factory." - Fatoumata S, Summer 2013 Alumnus

Other Ways You Can Help:

  • Share this campaign with family, friends, and coworkers
  • Spread word about the application process to local schools and organizations. Applications for the Summer of 2015 are due on March 1st.
  • Volunteer with Trip of a Lifetime (visit www.projecttoal.org for more information)

Have a Happy Holidays and no matter your destination, remember that #travelchangesyou

- The Trip of a Lifetime team
story_txt:
Update: Make a donation of any size between now and January 4th and you will automatically be entered into a raffle to win four New York Yankees Field Box Tickets.

Short Summary Think back to your most memorable travel experience. Who did you travel with? Where did you visit? 
Regardless of purpose or destination; travel changes us. It forces us to step out of our comfort zone, experience diverse cultures, and most importantly learn about ourselves. Why should only some students have the opportunity to experience the positive benefits of travel?
Trip of a Lifetime aims to change the way students experience travel by providing summer travel scholarships and leadership development programs to deserving students that might never have the opportunity to travel otherwise. The organization needs your help this holiday season to make our vision a reality.
Here are some highlights of Trip of a Lifetime:  Provided scholarships for 44 underprivileged students
Completely student run and operated
Featured in the Wall Street Journal, NY Post, and Poughkeepsie Journal
Recognized by the New York City Department of Education 



Bria T, Briana T, Peaches W, and Selina A at Alcatraz, Summer 2014

  What We Need & What You Get  This holiday season, we are asking for $5,000, enough to provide a full travel scholarship to one student. While this is a lot of money, remember that each student trip impacts an additional 25-50 students upon their return! In return for your generosity, we have some great perks available including t-shirts, hoodies, and travel themed gift baskets, all designed by trip alumni themselves.  



Trip of a Lifetime founder Stan Rosenberg and Nouman I, Summer 2014 alumnus at a school visit in Brooklyn, NY

   The Impact  Travel is more than a trip; it's a lifelong journey. Your gift will instill leadership, confidence, and hope in some of this generation's brightest students, enabling them to become catalysts for change in their communities. Trip of a Lifetime is completely student run and operated. We have no overhead cost or full time staff so every dollar counts 
Did You Know: 100% of all Trip of a Lifetime alumni are currently in college or are college bound

Don't just take it from us. Here are some testimonials from students that have traveled with our organization:



"This trip taught me that one man's trash is another person's treasure." - Jessica U, Summer 2013 Alumnus





"When I first stepped foot in California, it was eye-opening; I felt like Charlie when he enters Willy Wonka's chocolate factory." - Fatoumata S, Summer 2013 Alumnus


    Other Ways You Can Help:
  Share this campaign with family, friends, and coworkers
Spread word about the application process to local schools and organizations. Applications for the Summer of 2015 are due on March 1st. Volunteer with Trip of a Lifetime (visit www.projecttoal.org for more information)   Have a Happy Holidays and no matter your destination, remember that #travelchangesyou- The Trip of a Lifetime team

story:
Nice to meet you!

Zip Zap Circus School is a vibrant social circus based in Cape Town, South Africa.

Founded in 1992 by Brent van Rensburg and Laurence Estève, our circus school proudly provides free circus and performing arts training for youth from different walks of life. Zip Zap is a diverse, loving family committed to teaching the invaluable life skills of trust, honesty, responsibility, teamwork and discipline, while training and playing in the circus.

The success of Zip Zap is internationally recognised, with professional performances in more than 16 countries and many artistic and public awards won.
Our true achievement lies in the positive effect circus has played in so many children's lives, and the opportunities to touch more are boundless. 

These miracles have been happening in our Zip Zap dome since it was erected in 2008, so imagine the possibilities of a new and fully-equipped building...

Now is the time to make Zip Zap's legacy last and move into a permanent home. And you can be part of it.


How to help make our dream come true

Circus is all about shows, training, sparkles, improving yourself; and all of this requires money. We saved a bit along the way, we even took out a loan, but it is still not enough to cover the big investment cost of this fantastic project. So here we are.
All the money we will raise here on Indiegogo will go towards funding the renovation of the new building. Everything is ready, the architectural model looks incredible, and we just need this extra help to get it going.
We have prepared exciting perks to thank you for helping us. Give it a glance and choose yours! We are very excited about welcoming you to our big and loving family. 
If we don't reach our entire goal (but we're confident we will), we will keep applying for grants, writing letters and phoning people. The amount collected will still help us get one step closer to having our building dream realised.




The Impact

Whether you can give 10$ or 100$, we are very grateful for your contribution. It warms our hearts to feel supported and to know that you are excited about our project. 
If you are reading this page, consider sending a message to 2 or 3 of your friends or family. It might be a small step for you but it has a huge impact on our campaign.




Risks & Challenges

Of course such an ambitious project comes with its risks. So far, and with circus magic on our side, we've been able to grow and expand successfully for more than two decades. We have won many prizes and awards, from the Monte Carlo Circus Festival in Monaco to the Cultural Affairs and Sport Department of the Western Cape government. If you decide to join the journey, you will be one more person in our team and we will become invincible.



Other Ways You Can Help

If you find our project cool, let the world know about it and tell all your friends! Remember, sharing is caring!

If you think you could help us in any way, have any questions or if you would like to get to know us, please let's get in touch: info@zip-zap.co.za 



With love and trapeze,

Laurence, Brent and the Zip Zap family.

story:
Hannah Slaney goes to the World Championships!

I need your help to raise money to enable me to compete for my country at the Youth Climbing Championships in Sept (2014) in New Caledonia just off the coast of Australia.

  • I am a Bristol based climber and I am 14 years old. I climb at Undercover Rock and my coach is Ben West. I also train with British Team Boulderer Max Ayrton.
  • I have been climbing since I was 8 years old when I attended a birthday party at UCR and Ben encouraged me to start climbing. 
  • I was selected for the GB lead climbing team in April 2014. I am the current BMC youth climbing series champion, having defended my title last weekend at  EICA Ratho and the winner of the British Boulder Championships, round 2 at TCA Glasgow.
  • I  made the finals and came 6th in my first European Cup in June  and now I need your help to get to the World Champs!
  • In 2014 I have found form and shown that I can consistently get results against the best in Europe. I want more and with your help I can move to the international stage and show what I can do.

How you can help

I need £3000 to pay for flights, accommodation for 10 days and living expenses.
I am hoping for small donations from lots of people and I think we can do it. So please, please donate either by credit card or PayPal:))
Look out for me at the following events. Come and chat, ask for climbing tips.
BLOC summer boulder comp
ClimbBristol
The Quay Deep Water Soloing Competition
St Bons school summer fair 
If I don't reach my entire goal I don't have a Plan B, yet, to get me there!
I am happy to negotiate attendance at any corporate events, in return for a donation,  or coaching tips on how I climb and train or even to compete against you on  a mobile or local indoor climbing wall under supervision of a qualified adult.
If I exceed my target I will use funds to pay for training and travel expenses to competitions.

What it means to me.

I want you to know that I am a fairly normal kid who loves to climb and I know that I can't do this one on my own.
I want others to be inspired and to know that anything is possible with training and committment. Climbing is more accessible than ever. Go to your local wall, gain the skills you need through NICAS and get outdoors and most important of all have fun.
Your support means 'the world' to me!!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to donate it doesn't mean that you can't help.

Spread the word about my campaign. Get involved and use the Indiegogo share tool, facebook and twitter to share my story. If you know any companies that would be willing to donate in return for me writing my story in their newsletter, or  coming to their team-building events  for a 'beat the teenager' climb-athon - just let me know.

story:
I'm running my last marathon in Copenhagen in May. It will be my 10th one and as I have never raised money before through my running,  this last time  I’m raising money for an apolitical non-profit organisation called Teach for Palestine where my daughter  is currently a volunteer. 

Teach for Palestine is based in the West-Bank and provides structured English classes for at-risk young girls in the villages and refugee camps surrounding Nablus. The English classes are based on the national Palestinian English curriculum and give the girls an opportunity to build on the vocab and structures they need to excel at school. The lessons provided present the material in an innovative and creative way ensuring the girls not only build on their English skills but also enjoy learning the language.

A good knowledge of English is vital for the girls’ future careers and through teaching in villages and refugee camps TFP aims to help the most marginalized girls in Palestinian Society. TFP provides quality education to children who otherwise would have no such opportunity. These extra English classes every day make a real difference to the girls’ language skills and  TFP can see a tangible improvement in the girls’ grasp of basic structures and conversation skills.

The money I raise will go towards will go towards resources for the teachers such as pens, paper and other materials. Any donation will be appreciated – it all adds up! I know times are hard for many of us-but any little helps these young girls reach for the future they deserve.

story:
The Need:

Israelis and Palestinians are skeptical regarding the prospects to achieve a fair and sustainable peace agreement. The lack of information about the issues in contention and the possible solutions create a vacuum that is filled up with voices that ingrain the skepticism.

The Initiative:

peacehub is a political intervention initiative designed to encourage our leaders to negotiate in earnest in order to reach a fair and sustainable agreement between Israelis and Palestinians.

At the heart of the initiative is a live webcast of internationally mediated professional negotiations between Israeli and Palestinian delegations.

The Impact:

Accessing the talks to homes everywhere live online will give the public a unique opportunity to witness and experience high level, professional conflict resolution talks and partake in a process that to date has left us without a voice. 

Tackling the core issues of the conflict - Jerusalem, Palestinian refugees, security, territory -- will give Israelis and Palestinians insight into the official process and enrich the public discourse with expert information, presenting the feasibility of an agreement.

For the past months, we have engaged top professional negotiators, research institutes and others who share our belief in the concept and its potential impact. Working with limited funds, with a small team of dedicated volunteers, we have carved a wide network of cross-disciplinary collaborations to establish the basic infrastructure of the initiative.  To now advance it to production and to carry the live broadcast of the peacehub talks, we need your support.

With the official negotiations in a seemingly continual crisis, peacehub is a de facto "track two" negotiation channel that strives to keep the essence of the matters in contention and especially the possible solutions in center of the public discourse.

Peacehub is a proactive tool to empower the vast majority of both Israelis and Palestinians who want to reach a fair and sustainable agreement.

Help us make it happen! 

What We Need & What You Get:

We need to fund the production of the negotiations summit and broadcast it.  The minimal budget is set at $305,000.  So far, we have raised $55,000 from private donors and public foundations.  As we continue the fundraising effort, we are also working to secure in-kind donations and corporate sponsorships.  Time is of essence.  To be relevant, we have scheduled the talks/broadcast for June 16-19, 2014.  We need $65,000 by mid May to secure the basic infrastructure of the event:  flights and accommodations for the participants, video equipment and tv production team.

Your support will be recognized with a special honor certificate, t shirts, on-site signage, a special signed edition of the DVD of the negotiations, a special VIP access to the negotiations and... hopefully being a step closer to the agreement we all yearn for!

story:
I wrote Rewired because I want others to experience the simple, common-sense approach to recovery that saved my life.

By the age of 25, addiction had stolen the very essence of my being. I remember being up in bed at night, asking myself, “What happened to me? Where have I gone? What is this empty life I’m living?” That's when I knew something had to change. 

In my book Rewired, which will be published this April by Hatherleigh Press and distributed by Random House, I explain a path that helped me achieve not just physical sobriety but also emotional, mental, and spiritual sobriety, or what I like to call a whole-soul makeover.

In Rewired, I present a revolutionary approach to addiction and recovery that will save lives. I know – because it saved mine.

Your Support Will Save Lives

My goal is to raise $50,0000 to fund a tour that will spread Rewired's message to as many people as I can. I know from first-hand experience that Rewired can save lives. I also know that not everyone may have access to the new approaches to addiction and recovery that Rewired offers.

I will use the funds I raise to arrange a nationwide tour of speaking engagements, book signings, Q&A sessions, media appearances, and visits to as many rehabilitation centers and sober living houses as possible. 

At each stop of my tour, I will donate copies of Rewired so that people can easily access the tools they need to stay sober and alive.

I will also donate a portion of all funds raised to the Brent Shapiro Foundation for Alcohol and Drug Awareness.

I need your support to make this dream a reality. 

Every donation – no matter the amount – brings us $1 closer to saving lives by sharing the Rewired movement. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, I welcome you to connect with me on Facebook and Twitter to share your stories and to support people who are on sober journeys.

You can also share this campaign with your family and friends so that we get as much support and as many good wishes as possible.

How To Pre-Order Rewired

"There are few people who truly understand the disease of addiction and the attainability of recovery as well as Erica Spiegelman. Rewired is a must read for anyone seeking the essential internal tools to make recovery a reality." 

Robert L. Shapiro, Attorney and Chairman, the Brent Shapiro Foundation for Alcohol and Drug Awareness

Rewired is available for pre-order on Amazon. Click here to pre-order your copy.

story:
For the last three years, the students of architecture at the University of South Australia have been putting their blood, sweat, tears, superglue, cardboard and exorbitant printing costs into creating the design language of the future. Their final design studio culminates in an exhibition centred around communal cohesion, collaboration, and sharing. 


ArcHive.


This exhibition represents a juncture in our education. Some of us will continue to the Masters program at UniSA. Some may study architecture elsewhere, or study in other fields. Still others may leave and pursue careers. What we want is create a night to celebrate what we've done and what we're yet to do. Your contribution will help do that by funding the lighting, sound, bar and drinks, furnishings and venue bump in and bump out. The exhibition is on Friday November 21st 2014.

story:
Sigma Chi Nu alumni will need to raise $960 to pay for the tree and plaque to be placed where the large Oak tree used to be on the front lawn.  We will run future campaigns to place a teak bench around the tree, reminiscent of the bench so many of us remember from our days in the house.


We are also using this campaign to raise the money for this year's reunion, June 12-14, 2015, at Alfred University!


Please be as generous as you can, share this campaign with as many Sigma sisters as you can, talk it up, and, most importantly...We'd love to see you at Reunion 2015!


Altruistically Yours,
Kara Mackey Dopman, 1988

story:
Why Gardens?
Because gardens produce healthier food. Only 2% of American children eat enough fruits and vegetables, and 1 in 3 American children born after 2000 is at risk for Type II diabetes. A garden is an introduction to the real, healthy food students and families need.

Because gardens can help fix America's nature deficit. With more than 80% of Americans living in cities and suburbs, we need to work harder than ever to teach the values of natural processes.

Because gardens are a living laboratory for education. Not just healthy food—a lesson on what producing healthy food requires. Not just exposure to nature—a way for children to literally harvest the fruits of their labor.

A True Seed Investment 
For as little as $10, you can help a community reap all the benefits a garden has to offer. In just 39 days, we plan to raise $2500 per garden; to feed,  teach, and inspire people in each of these 100 communities. Here are a few things our garden plans to do with your donations:

The Paramount School of Excellence garden is a school-wide effort to grow flowers and vegetables for Paramount staff, students and families. Every classroom has their own garden bed that teachers can use to reinforce state standards through hands-on gardening activities. The garden is open to the community after school hours, offering a peaceful place to find refuge amidst the urban chaos of Indy's near east side. Our goal is to offer educational summer garden programing to Paramount students.

CHECK OUT THE GALLERY FOR IMAGES & VIDEOS

Look Good, Do Good
With every contribution to our garden, donors will receive organic, ethical perks from PACT. Our socks, undies, and t-shirts are produced to high standards of sustainability, with the comfiest organic materials we can find. You'll be giving out of the goodness of your heart, and in return you'll get PACT goodies. It's a win-win situation.

The Paramount School of Excellence garden is a school-wide effort to grow flowers and vegetables for Paramount staff, students and families. Every classroom has their own garden bed that teachers can use to reinforce state standards through hands-on gardening activities. The garden is open to the community after school hours, offering a peaceful place to find refuge amidst the urban chaos of Indy's near east side. Our goal is to offer educational summer garden programing to Paramount students.
CHECK OUT THE GALLERY FOR IMAGES & VIDEOSLook Good, Do GoodWith every contribution to our garden, donors will receive organic, ethical perks from PACT. Our socks, undies, and t-shirts are produced to high standards of sustainability, with the comfiest organic materials we can find. You'll be giving out of the goodness of your heart, and in return you'll get PACT goodies. It's a win-win situation.

story:
As a new teacher, I wasn’t exactly sure what to expect in my classroom. I knew the content I had to cover, the assessments I was required to conduct, and the classroom management techniques I would need to use, but no textbook or professor could prepare me for the students, their stories, their struggles, and the ‘baggage’ they carried with them. In an ‘inner city’ high school, you’re more than a teacher; you are, at times, a confidant, a counsellor, a listening ear and a helping hand. The responsibility that comes with teaching is both terrifying and inspiring, and my first few years of teaching have motivated me to use my passion, energy, and skills to assist others in need, and I believe Kenya is the perfect destination for this. 

 

I know I cannot solve all of the problems that exist in our world, but I can perhaps solve one, and make the difference in one child’s life, and to me, that is a pretty good start…….

 

"If you can't feed a hundred people, then feed just one."

-Mother Teresa

 

My first year of teaching at a high school in Scarborough certainly opened my eyes to the struggles that many families within the school community endure. Despite these hardships, the children in our community have the option of attending a local and safe school, where there is a roof over their head, a pencil in hand, paper to write on, materials to use, and programs to provide basic meals.

 

Many Kenyan students are not fortunate enough to have access to the aforementioned items; it was only recently that education alone was made free. For the month of August, as a volunteer with Free the Children: Adventure Learning Experience, I will be given the opportunity to dedicate my time and energy to a community in need. I am going to teach and volunteer at local schools, contribute to the building of a school, and assist to improve the local community of the Masai Mara.

 

This is where I need you help:

We are asked to bring supplies and materials to conduct our lessons as well as to donate to the local school. The schools are in dire need of pencils, pens, markers, pencil crayons, paper, notebooks, scissors, glue sticks, soccer balls, volleyballs, and other school supplies and sporting equipment.

Additionally, the people of Masai Mara are also in need of Band-Aids, deodorant, toothbrushes, toothpaste, and other toiletry items.

Our program is also affiliated with an orphanage that cares for children with AIDS, and we are asked to donate clothing (new or gently used) for infants, youth and adults.

With your assistance and monetary donations, I would like to provide the students and community of the Masai Mara with the basic necessities that we often take for granted. If you feel a connection with this cause, any amount of donation would be truly and greatly appreciated. Every little bit helps.

I will also post updates with respect to how your funds are being used and allocated.  

If perhaps you would like to donate material items, please contact me at shannon.hagarty@rogers.com and we can discuss arrangements.

 

“Be the change that you wish to see in the world.” 

― Mahatma Gandhi

 

I am involved in many charities that are each unique and wonderful, however I am most excited about this endeavour. I may be sleeping in a tent under a mosquito net for a month, without the luxury of showering, while being disconnected from the world of social media, but I will be involved in making a change. I will be involved in building a school, a safe place for children to attend. I will be involved in educating the youth of Kenya, giving them a chance to break the cycle of poverty, dream big and reach their goals. I will be involved…… and this undoubtedly embodies Ghandi’s philosophy, and through our donations and actions we will be the ‘change’ that is needed within our world. As mentioned in the video, it is more than a charity; it is about providing sustainability, and I couldn’t be more excited to play a role in this.

I feel that it is my time to give back, and with your help, I hope that I can make this a possibility. I must remember that nobody can do everything, but everyone can do something; together we can make a difference.  

 

Have a blessed and safe summer.

 

Shannon xo

story: I have no talent for languages, but really enjoy them. I like finding pen pals online from the country itself. I try to listen to a lot of music of the language, so find bands of a music type you enjoy, it will at least help somewhat with correct pronunciation. I have to admit I am much better at understanding written German than being able to translate it while listening, however I am certain I have provided hours of entertainment to the poor folks in Germany who have had to listen to me. Now I want to tke German courses but it's paid. If you guys help me to raise some money I would be happy!

story:
UPDATE

After extensive consultations, we have decided to change our Indiegogo campaign approach. We now request our supporters to support these girls on yearly basis so that they can be able to closely monitor and evaluate their progress each year. We will carry out the same campaign once each year to let our supporters know of the girl's progress and requirements, and if there are new girls in need of assistance. We already have one more girl, Esther Kasisi whom we rescued over the weekend. Our supporters also have an option of personally sponsoring an individual girl at $140 each month and get to monitor and evaluate the girls through school progress reports, communicating directly with the girls through email or letters and quarterly updates about the girls from AMLI.

We now request supporters to help us reach $11,760 target in this campaign enough to take care of these girls for one year and we will be repeating this campaign once each year until these girls finishes their education.

Our grassroots education volunteers who are women, helps us to rescue these girls and the girls we have so far rescued are in AIC primary school { government owned} with boarding facilities, a fenced school save zone, a female matron who is in charge of them as well as security at all times to protect them. In liaison with the school management, AMLI closely monitors the girls and receives reports about them on weekly basis to ensure they are okay. Once a girl is rescued, they are protected by government law and no one can interfere with them while they are in school because they will be arrested. But schools need money to cover these girl’s expenses in school.

Help us reach our one year target of $11,760 NOW!!

 

 

FACTS ABOUT GENDER INEQUALITY IN MAASAI LAND

Like   most poor women in African nations, Maasai Women are destined to live a life with limited choices. More than eighty percent of Maasai women will never have a single day of formal education. They will never learn to read or write or speak a language other than their native Maa. Not one in ten will reach the eighth grade. All but the most defiant will be “circumcised” at the age of twelve or thirteen and soon afterwards married to a man her father chooses. She will never be allowed to divorce, except in the most egregious cases of physical abuse, and will never be allowed to marry again, even if the husband her father chooses in an old man who dies when she is still in her teens. She will be one of her husband’s multiple wives, and will have many children, regardless of her health or ability to provide for them. She will rise early every day to milk cows, and spend  her days walking miles to water holes to launder clothes and get water, and to gather wood to carry back home. If she is lucky, she will have a donkey to share her burden. She will live a life with few physical comforts, dependent on a husband and a family she did not choose.

 

PRISCILLA - ONE OF THE VICTIMS

Many cases like Priscilla’s take place each day in Maasai land and more girls are expected to run away from their homes. We keep our ears and eyes on the ground to help those who will require our assistance. Through your support, we will be able to mitigate this problem. However, Across Maasai Land Initiative {AMLI}is working on along term solution tot his problem by involving parents as part of the solution and making it easier for girls to get assistance whenever they need it. Our long term goal is to reach as many girls as possible across Maasai land in Kenya.

THE ORPHANS WITH PARENTS

There is no better way to describe Jackline, Ruth Moipa, Hellen, Esther, Abigail and Ruth Nasieku apart from “ORPHANS WITH PARENTS” Now that they have escaped from their homes, their parents will not support them with anything, and instead, they will wait for them to be stranded and return back home to be married. These girls are now effectively on their own and without supervision or even a roof over their heads, there is great risk of them becoming pregnant which will make them more vulnerable to abuse and neglect. It is only education that will save them from prostitution.

The cultural, economic and physical barriers that combine to deny education to Maasai girls in Kenya are numerous, and taken together, almost impossible for all but the most determined girls to overcome. The six girls below have passed their first huddle of running away from their homes, but the big challenge of being able to stay in school still stares on their faces. It is only through your support hat these girls will be able to overcome these challenges.

The six girls above still have two years in primary school, four years in high school an four years in University. To complete their first six years in both primary and high school, they need food, boarding fees which covers {bed, electricity, water, cooks, and watchman and matron monthly payments}, uniforms {dress, blouse, shoes, socks, panties, bikers etc}, Transportation, and personal school supplies like bathing and washing soaps, tooth paste, tooth brush, shoes polish, shoe brush, toilet paper, Vaseline, pens, exercise books and the most important sanitary towels.

Each girl will require $140.4 each month for the above expenses which adds to $10108.24 for the six years per each girl {in primary and high school only}. The grand total required to support these six girls for the six years is $60649.44. It is only through your support that this could be realized to save these innocent girls from being send back home to go through Priscilla’s experience.

INVEST IN THESE GIRLS FUTURE LIVES – DONATE NOW

For more information visit our website at     

http://amlikenya.org/

http://amlikenya.org/

story:
Dear friends and family,

In 2002, when I established a community network to prevent child and youth involvement in violent conflict in the eastern Democratic Republic of Congo, I already knew from my own experience of that conflict as a displaced child over the previous 8 years that peacebuilding was the field where my contribution in my community and country was most needed. What I was still to know, and indeed started realizing after few years of community work, was that conflicts in our changing world are so complex and the needs of the affected people so challenging that passion, dedication and good intentions alone are often not enough to bring about the change we envision for our world. This has been a personal challenge for several years, a really disturbing challenge indeed.

It is an immense pleasure today to seek your support for the wonderful opportunity I currently have to meet that challenge and subsequently bring about a significant change in my community, personal and professional life as a young peace worker in the war-torn eastern Congo!

The opportunity

In late September 2012, I received news from Coventry University (UK) that I was admitted in their Masters of Art in Peacebuilding, a unique programme that draws from experiences of effective resolution of complex conflicts in several parts of the world during the past decades to train the next generation of peacebuilders. When I received these news, I immediately felt that this was the right opportunity for my passion and commitment for peacebuilding to get matched with the skills and tools I need in order to deliver more effective and durable community rebuilding and empowerment solutions. The masters programme lasts one-year and is delivered online for the great part, with two 3-day residential workshops on Coventry University’s campuses in the UK and Turkey. You can find more about the masters at: http://wwwm.coventry.ac.uk/RESEARCHNET/CPRS/PROSPECTIVESTUDENTS/PEACEBUILDINGMA/Pages/OnlineMAinPeacebuilding.aspx. Upon completion of the programme, I will have increased my understanding of violent conflicts and of the processes involved in political and security reconstruction, socioeconomic reconstruction and justice and reconciliation.

I need your help 

I sought admission in that masters programme out of a deep need for self-improvement but I was not expecting things to go so fast and my admission to come immediately, without me having to save enough to prepare these studies.

The total cost for attending the programme is 14,580 $. With a partial scholarship from the UK-based Allan and Nesta Ferguson Trust covering part of it, I need 8,910 $ between now and May 2013 to cover half of the tuition fees and the costs of travel to the two residential workshops in 2013. This is a long way to go but my intuition refuses to give up! I am currently gearing up for months of savings during which achieving that big step forward in my personal and professional development journey will be at the top of my priorities. I expect my savings over the next six months to cover half of the remaining costs and I am seeking your support towards the other half ($ 4,500), which I need to pay this year in order for me to keep my scholarship from the Ferguson Trust and to have my place in the programme confirmed. My admission in the programme was in fact conditional upon payment of $ 3,300 tuition fees by November 5 and that is the decisive part of all the process.

Having never spoke publicly about matters of this kind, it is with a knot in my throat that I am writing this today, but the opportunity I have in front me is so life-changing that I hope you understand why I am taking that move. I believe that every step towards making that project successful will be the result of your help, and behind that, of the love, encouragement and support that I will know is backing me in that endeavor.

How you can help

Every donation (no matter the amount) is one more step towards making that happen, and so is any effort to pass the word around and invite others to join. I cannot think of a greater gratitude to your contribution in that campaign than my future total commitment to the cause I am seeking to advance by taking that masters course.

 

Asante sana (Thank you very much!),

Guelord

story:
Hello Everyone, 

As some of you may know my name is Kimberly Susic and I attend San Francisco State University. My major is Cinema and I plan on graduating this Spring. However, due to budget cuts and less financial aid money to go around, this semester is going to be very tight financially. That is why I'm asking for YOUR help. I'm hoping to raise $5000 to help cover tuition, books, transportation fees, and food. So, whether you donate simply $5 or $100, I appreciate your contribution towards me finishing my education. 

Regardless of whether you make a donation or not, thank you!! :):)

-Kim Susic

story:
Introduction

spt is a simple concept with powerful possibilities.  It is what it’s name implies:  a simple phishing toolkit.  It is an open source phishing education toolkit that aims to help in securing the mind as opposed to securing computers. Organizations spend billions of dollars annually in an effort to safeguard information systems, but spend little to nothing on the under trained and susceptible minds that operate these systems, thus rendering most technical protections instantly ineffective. A single targeted link is all it takes to bypass the most advanced security protections. The link is clicked, the deed is done.

The basic idea we (the spt project) had was that wouldn’t it be cool if there were a simple, effective, easy to use and free (most importantly!) tool that information security professionals could use to evaluate and train what we all know is the weakest link in any security minded organization:  the people.  Since the founders of the spt project are themselves information security professionals by day (and crazy developers by night), they themselves faced the frustration of dealing with people within their own organizations that claimed to know better, but 9 times out of 10 fell for the most absurdly obvious phishing emails ever seen.  A malware outbreak here, a stolen password and loss of critical organizational data there and the costs of dealing with the results of phishing can get to be astronomical pretty darn quickly!

Enter spt.  spt was made from scratch with the goal of giving over-worked and under-staffed information security professionals a simple tool (more like a framework, as we continue to add more features over time) that could be used to identify and train those weakest links.  spt is a fully self-contained phishing email toolkit that can be installed, configured and phishing in less than 2 minutes.  Its design is modular and open-ended allowing for future expansion and additional features via easy to snap-in modules that are simply uploaded in the administration dashboard.

spt was developed from the ground up to provide a simple and easy to use framework to identify your weakest links so that you can patch the human vulnerability.  If the spt project sounds interesting to you, please consider supporting continued development on the project with a generous contribution.  

What We Need & What You Get

We came a long way in the first year of the project (our one year project birthday was October 24, 2012), but we have even bigger goals for the spt project going forward.  Some of the things we would like to to do that will take money include the following:

  • Have a full security audit on performed on the code by a reputable firm, so we can then review and correct issues.  We feel this is important to have done externally, in addition to the audits we will be performing, to ensure that nothing is missed and the spt code is as secure as it possibly can be.
  • Development, and operation, of a front-end (spt code) / back-end (server on the Internet) solution that automates the collection of anonymous statistics from install spt instances on an opt-in basis.  This will allow the creation of a data warehouse that provides education effectiveness statistics across all opted-in spt installations broken down by geographic region and industry, or such.
  • Development of an inline upgrade and module installation process, allowing you to easily keep your spt installation up to date.
  • Implementation of a scheduling engine, allowing you to configure new campaigns to run now or at a future date, without requiring you be actively logged into spt at that time.  This will greatly improve the mail flow process for larger organizations that have tens of thousands of targets to educate, as well as allowing organizations of any size to have more granular control over when campaigns run.
  • Development of better processes (i.e. making required changes to spt email sending processes) to integrate into the enterprise and get messages delivered more often.

Your help, with a contribution of any size, will be greatly appreciated and will help us to be able to continue development on the spt project and to move towards the goals above.

We have some awesome perks lined up that we think fit in well with the spirit of the spt project.  Sorry, but can only ship the coffee mug to US addresses and not internationally.  Stickers can go to either.  Thanks!

Why do we care about phishing?

Simple answer.  Phishing has become one of the easiest ways to remotely separate people from that which is important to them:  their money.

What is the media saying about phishing's effectiveness?

"Cyber criminals are going after online banking users with phishing attacks and taking advantage of user 'bad habits' to spread malware, according to a security researcher from Kaspersky Lab.

The cyber crime ecosystem is diverse, with many different types of criminals serving as players, but the most dangerous are the ones targeting endpoint devices and unsuspecting users, Dmitry Bestuzhev, head of global research and analysis in Latin America for Kaspersky Lab, said during a presentation last week in Moscow. He discussed how many of the attacks arrive in user inboxes as spam."

- Phishing remains most reliable cyber fraud mechanism

"Spammers [are] baiting consumers with phishing emails to try and steal banking credentials when they know their spam campaigns aren’t working."

- Phish Tastes Better Than Spam

What are people saying about the spt?

"The toolkit lives up to its name: It’s extremely simple to install and to use. Using a copy of WampServer — a free software bundle that includes Apache, PHP and MySQL — I was able to install the toolkit and create a Gmail phishing campaign in less than five minutes."

- Krebs on Security: Phishing Your Employees 101

"A tool everyone should use…I think it is absolutely awesome.

It is one of the most polished new release security tools that I have ever seen. I strongly recommend that every organization play around it and try to implement, kind of a human vulnerabiltiy assessment for their own internal organization on a regular basis. This tool rocks and the folks at PaulDotCom Security Weekly would like to say well done, so please keep up the good work."

- Hack Naked TV Episode 26 (John Strand): Segment starting at 1:38 (transcribed from the show, any errors are ours alone)

"By now, most folks have heard of phishing scams, and know to be on the lookout for fake PayPal and bank sign-ons. But what happens when your co-workers get a link to a site that looks just like the corporate intranet? Using the Simple Phishing Toolkit (SPT) you can find out."

- Joe Brockmeier (ReadWriteWeb): Bait Your Users with the Simple Phishing Toolkit

"Derek and Will, the creators of the Spear Phishing Toolkit, had the exact same idea and have built a great tool that can be used in exactly this fashion. Create campaigns, email your users, and track who is clicking links in emails and entering credentials. These are the people who need a little more help with identifying the emails that are going to get them, and the company, into trouble. From there, you can build an extra training specifically designed for them that addresses the problems they may be seeing. You can also keep better eyes on your risky users for indicators of compromise.

We recently implemented this type of interactive education at Go Daddy to help educate our users about the dangers of phishing and how to spot a phish… unbeknownst to them, of course. This exercise is helping us target the users who aren’t successfully avoiding a phish, with more education. It’s going to take some time to tell whether or not this program is truly successful. However, it’s better than letting the bad guys ramp-up their tactics and hoping that our users will be successful at avoiding the attack on their own."

- Inside GoDaddy.com: Phishing in Your Own Pond

Thanks!

Thank you (huge thank you!) from the spt project for checking us out!  Education beats phishing!
story_txt:
Introduction
spt is a simple concept with powerful possibilities.  It is what it’s name implies:  a simple phishing toolkit.  It is an open source phishing education toolkit that aims to help in securing the mind as opposed to securing computers. Organizations spend billions of dollars annually in an effort to safeguard information systems, but spend little to nothing on the under trained and susceptible minds that operate these systems, thus rendering most technical protections instantly ineffective. A single targeted link is all it takes to bypass the most advanced security protections. The link is clicked, the deed is done.The basic idea we (the spt project) had was that wouldn’t it be cool if there were a simple, effective, easy to use and free (most importantly!) tool that information security professionals could use to evaluate and train what we all know is the weakest link in any security minded organization:  the people.  Since the founders of the spt project are themselves information security professionals by day (and crazy developers by night), they themselves faced the frustration of dealing with people within their own organizations that claimed to know better, but 9 times out of 10 fell for the most absurdly obvious phishing emails ever seen.  A malware outbreak here, a stolen password and loss of critical organizational data there and the costs of dealing with the results of phishing can get to be astronomical pretty darn quickly!Enter spt.  spt was made from scratch with the goal of giving over-worked and under-staffed information security professionals a simple tool (more like a framework, as we continue to add more features over time) that could be used to identify and train those weakest links.  spt is a fully self-contained phishing email toolkit that can be installed, configured and phishing in less than 2 minutes.  Its design is modular and open-ended allowing for future expansion and additional features via easy to snap-in modules that are simply uploaded in the administration dashboard.spt was developed from the ground up to provide a simple and easy to use framework to identify your weakest links so that you can patch the human vulnerability.  If the spt project sounds interesting to you, please consider supporting continued development on the project with a generous contribution.  
What We Need & What You Get
We came a long way in the first year of the project (our one year project birthday was October 24, 2012), but we have even bigger goals for the spt project going forward.  Some of the things we would like to to do that will take money include the following:

Have a full security audit on performed on the code by a reputable firm, so we can then review and correct issues.  We feel this is important to have done externally, in addition to the audits we will be performing, to ensure that nothing is missed and the spt code is as secure as it possibly can be.
Development, and operation, of a front-end (spt code) / back-end (server on the Internet) solution that automates the collection of anonymous statistics from install spt instances on an opt-in basis.  This will allow the creation of a data warehouse that provides education effectiveness statistics across all opted-in spt installations broken down by geographic region and industry, or such.
Development of an inline upgrade and module installation process, allowing you to easily keep your spt installation up to date.
Implementation of a scheduling engine, allowing you to configure new campaigns to run now or at a future date, without requiring you be actively logged into spt at that time.  This will greatly improve the mail flow process for larger organizations that have tens of thousands of targets to educate, as well as allowing organizations of any size to have more granular control over when campaigns run.
Development of better processes (i.e. making required changes to spt email sending processes) to integrate into the enterprise and get messages delivered more often.
Your help, with a contribution of any size, will be greatly appreciated and will help us to be able to continue development on the spt project and to move towards the goals above.

"Spammers [are] baiting consumers with phishing emails to try and steal banking credentials when they know their spam campaigns aren’t working."
- Phish Tastes Better Than Spam
What are people saying about the spt?

story:
Mentorship

I've learned that everyone has at least one thing in common...  We're all people looking to get by and provide for our families.

This is an old sugar mill on the island of St. Kitts.  Every thursday, high school kids who haven't done well in their classes work in this mechanic shop under Keith.  The goal is to teach them a skill and offer them a career opportunity.

These kids are good, hardworking kids who are motivated to learn this trade.  The building is in bad shape, but even so this group of folks does some amazing work.  There is little the lead mechanics can't do out of this facility.

What We Need & What You Get

What I'd like to do:

  • Purchase trainer vehicles and engines $2,500 x2
  • Tool organizing furniture, workbenches and duplicate tools for student use $1,500

Donations of: 

  • $30+ will have their name painted on the trainer vehicle
  • $100+ will receive an emailed picture of your name and a personal thank you letter from a student
  • $2,500 Will have a trainer vehicle decorated in your honor

If you are able to travel out to St. Kitts, we can welcome you as honored guests and show you around the island!

The Impact

These kids show up each week to learn a trade they can use to provide for themselves and their families.  Upgrading these facilities and providing some appropriate training materials could have a lifelong impact on these students.  They are doing the best with very limitied facilities and materials.

I am a U.S. combat veteran, trained as an aviation mechanic.  I have worked in state of the art facilities maintaining helicopters.  These kids have the capability to accomplish amazing things and become great mechanics.  Not only would improved infrastructure improve their education, but these facilities could improve their income potential by facilitating larger mechanical projects.

We are all human and hope to provide for ourselves and our families.  A little investment in this educational program will benefit a large number of families in St. Kitts.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We could use:

  • Multi-tools such as Gerbers
  • A new roof on this building
  • A hydraulic lift
  • Tools!
  • Engines, transmissions and other components to use as training aids.

Anything helps!  All donation will go directly towards assisting these kids in developing their future's as mechanics!
