story:
The truth is, if we don’t own this movement, no one will.  History has shown that every unimaginable step toward justice and equity was made possible by brave and daring acts of ordinary people gathering, sharing, and eventually ORGANIZING. Institutionalizing an anti-racist curricula in NY Schools of Social Work which prepare professionals to practice competent social work practice depends on ongoing pressure from students and  alumni like yourselves. By supporting the Scholarship Fund to Undo Racism you will help today’s students to assume greater ownership of their education and to ensure that social work fully endorses moving beyond treating the symptoms of institutionalized oppression to activating strategies that eliminate the root causes.   Support students as they organize to hold the profession accountable to uphold its own ethical standards and social work professional values as noted by the NASW Code of Ethics.  Your donations to the  Scholarship Fund to Undo Racism will expand the number of social workers committed to Undoing Racism in both the profession and throughout wider society.


The Revolution Will Not Be Funded
SUPPORT THE SCHOLARSHIP FUND TO UNDO RACISM

Social workers and members of all the helping professions serve their communities best when informed by an anti-oppressive and anti-racist lens. Without this lens we risk misunderstanding our clients, designing ineffective programs and letting racism stand unchallenged.  More urgently, we risk becoming the oppressor. The need to create opportunities for students to gain additional knowledge in the area of race and racism is critical.

The Undoing Racism Internship Project (URIP) works with the People’s Institute for Survival and Beyond (PISAB) to transform social work practice by training students to become active organizers for social justice. The purpose of URIP is to strengthen the anti-racist analysis of social work students, faculty, and staff as well as field instructors and human service agencies. URIP provides a platform for social workers to recognize their role as gatekeepers and serve as catalysts for change.

 

URIP has established the new SCHOLARSHIP FUND TO UNDO RACISM to enable more students to attend the Undoing Racism Workshop offered by PISAB in New York City. Due to effective URIP organizing on many campuses over the last few years, more students recognize the urgency of having an anti-racist lens and are committed to attend the Undoing Racism Workshop.  However, the half-price $175 student rate is still a stretch for many students and stands as a barrier. Our goal is to enable students to attend at $75 per student. And if you can stretch yourself to give $5.00 more than your initial donation, students may even be able to attend for $0.00.

With your support, we can say YES to them! By contributing at least $5 to the new Scholarship Fund to Undo Racism you can help today’s social work students join the more than 5,000 students, practitioners, administrators and educators who have benefitted from Undoing Racism Workshops over the past ten years in the New York metropolitan area alone. Your contribution to the new Scholarship Fund to Undo Racism will help us to mentor, nurture, and support young people who want to join both the movement to undo racism and ranks of social justice organizers.

Donations will go directly to pay for students’ registration fees. Together we will expand and strengthen the movement to Undo Racism.  Thank you for contributing to the SCHOLARSHIP FUND TO UNDO RACISM.

Please join us this holiday season in making a generous contribution to the SCHOLARSHIP FUND TO UNDO RACISM that supports social work students who want to attend the Undoing Racism Workshop.

$10-25 URIP Sponsor

$25-75 URIP Advocate

$75-175 URIP Ally

$175+ URIP Pioneer

Undoing Racism Is Possible.  One Semester at a Time.

For inquiries: Please contact Silberman School of Social Work students/interns: Mary Ruth Govindavari & Jennie Encalada at undoingracisminternshipproject@gmail.com

story:
“You matter because you are you.  You matter to the very last moment of your life and we will do all we can not only to help you die peacefully, but also to live until you die.”

Dame Cicely Saunders - Founder of the Modern Day Hospice Movement

 

 

Our Story—Life is not endless, but it can be good until the very end.

Every life has a beginning and an end.  That’s the way it is. In the beginning, you cry, you are fed and you are held by people who love you.

 

The end should be no different. If you hurt, we will bring comfort. If you are scared, we will offer peace. If you are in need, we will provide. We are doctors, nurses, social workers, counselors, aides, and volunteers who are committed to your dignity. We are Hospice of Michigan.

 

Our sister hospice, St. Luke’s Hospice in , holds the same commitment and values for its patients. But nobody has all the answers. So Hospice of Michigan is working to send a core team of staff to St. Luke’s for a learning exchange that will bring better care, practices, and perspective to this crucial and unique work. Will you help?

 

 

 

The Impact

Do you have a Band-Aid in your medicine cabinet? We’re betting that you take that small, sterile wound cover for granted. Imagine, in , they make their own.  During Hospice of Michigan’s three year partnership with St. Luke’s Hospice, we have provided medical supplies and equipment unavailable to hospice patients there. We’ve also helped to fund additional nurses and aides for disadvantaged and rural areas.

 

St. Luke’s Hospice is headquarted in , , a place that might remind you of with its lights, bustling activity, premiere dining, and attractions.  St. Luke’s patients live miles outside of in villages and towns that offer a stark contrast to the modern city. 40% of St. Luke’s patients are dying of AIDS and another 60% are in a terminal stage of cancer. They are cared for in homes with dirt floors with few beds, and families frequently lack adequate food, medical supplies, and even clean, safe water.

 

Serving 800 patients a day, St. Luke’s Hospice’s team of nurses, physicians, and volunteers work to relieve pain and nausea, ease breathing problems, and educate and reassure patients and families so they know know what to expect as a disease progresses. Just as our staff at Hospice of does for our patients. These angels bring peace, comfort, and even joy to the last weeks and days of a patient’s life. Care is expensive, and no patient is turned away.

 

 

What We Need

Help Hospice of raise $10,000 to send a nurse and social worker to St. Luke’s Hospice for 10 days for a critical learning exchange program.

 

The cost of travel to St. Luke’s for our staff, Joan, a Registered Nurse and Fran, a licensed social worker, is $5,000 each. That makes a total of $10,000 for airfare, housing, and all travel expenses. While, in , Joan and Fran will learn more about the care offered by St. Luke’s and will share the latest studies about hospice and palliative care with St. Luke’s staff, helping them improve services for their patients. They will also bring back new ideas for our work in as they learn from the experiences of the staff at St. Luke’s Hospice and patient families. The circumstances may differ but the goal remains the same: to bring dignity and comfort to people as they die. 

 

Every dollar contributed will go directly to the St. Luke’s Hospice fund. Every. Dollar.  Hospice of will pay all administrative and other indirect costs. We believe that you will get us to our $10,000 goal! When we exceed our goal, Joan and Fran will be able to take more medical supplies with them to —you can do it!

 

If you are looking at this, you are a social media expert.  Help us get the word out—post us on your Facebook page, tweet about us, send us to your email address book.  Thank you!

 

 

What you get!

Seriously, think this one through—you or someone you love will benefit from hospice care someday. In the meantime, every dollar will go toward sending Joan and Fran to St. Luke’s so that the hospice in —and Hospice of Michigan—can improve life at its end, no matter where you live.

 

We look forward to keeping our supporters up to date on the trip and sharing photos and experiences from our clinicians while they travel to via email, Facebook and Twitter.  Please continue to help us spread the word about this exciting collaboration.  Thank you!

We look forward to keeping our supporters up to date on the trip and sharing photos and experiences from our clinicians while they travel to  via email, Facebook and Twitter.  Please continue to help us spread the word about this exciting collaboration.  Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Ken Smith, Associate Pastor at The Harbor Worship Center in Kingsland, Georgia.Our Pastor, Michael D. Sanes has been pastoring our church since 1995 and has faithfully followed the Lord's guiding. We are currently in a building program and are excited about what God is doing through us.

We are asking for your help today. We have several ministry opportunities that we would like to present to you and ask that you prayerfully consider participating.

We are trying to raise funds to equip our children's wing at our new facility. We need Playground equipment, fence, toys, storage bens, shelves, small tables and chairs, TV monitors, and cribs.

You can be a part of the ministry at The Harbor by choosing to give to this cause today. We are a growing ministry and have a strong children's department but we could use your help.

Please prayerfully consider giving to our cause. Your giving could help change a child's life. We appreciate your consideration.

Sincerely,

Ken Smith and the Ministry Team at The Harbor Worship Center

 

p.s. We are a 501(c)3 organization, so your contribution is tax deductible.
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hi, I'm Ken Smith, Associate Pastor at The Harbor Worship Center in Kingsland, Georgia.Our Pastor, Michael D. Sanes has been pastoring our church since 1995 and has faithfully followed the Lord's guiding. We are currently in a building program and are excited about what God is doing through us.
We are asking for your help today. We have several ministry opportunities that we would like to present to you and ask that you prayerfully consider participating.
We are trying to raise funds to equip our children's wing at our new facility. We need Playground equipment, fence, toys, storage bens, shelves, small tables and chairs, TV monitors, and cribs.
You can be a part of the ministry at The Harbor by choosing to give to this cause today. We are a growing ministry and have a strong children's department but we could use your help.
Please prayerfully consider giving to our cause. Your giving could help change a child's life. We appreciate your consideration.
Sincerely,
Ken Smith and the Ministry Team at The Harbor Worship Center
 
p.s. We are a 501(c)3 organization, so your contribution is tax deductible.

story:
Support NHD in PA and help send PA students to the National contest!

National History Day in Pennsylvania (NHD in PA) helps students learn 21st century academic and workplace skills through a proven program of research and inquiry.  More than 12,000 students participate each year.

NHD in PA is a component of a nationwide, year-long, classroom based program that engages students in hands-on historical research and exploration.  Students: 

  • Select a topic based on the annual theme, research and analyze primary and secondary sources, draw conclusions, and create projects to demonstrate their learning.
  • Work as individuals or groups to develop websites, documentaries, papers, performances, or exhibits to showcase their research findings.

NHD in PA enhances education in Pennsylvania, boosts achievement, and helps students develop academically and professionally.  (Rockman et al, 2010)

A strong, competitive statewide program helps maintain high standards and honors students for outstanding achievement.  You can help by sponsoring the state contest with your donation.

NHD in PA is managed by the Army Heritage Center Foundation, a 501(c)(3) non-profit corporation.  NHD in PA is self-funded through donations and student fees and receives no support from the federal, state, or local government.  Donations to National History Day in Pennsylvania are tax deductible.

This campaign is raising funds to support the state-wide National History Day in Pennsylvania program.


View Student Projects

We invite you to view the following student projects from the 2013 State Contest to see for yourself what NHD in PA students can achieve.

1st Place, Junior Group Documentary Category, 2013

The Iranian Revolution: Promised Heaven but Created Hell

1st Place, Junior Individual Website Category, 2013

Testing Mankind: Bikini Atoll As a Turning Point in America’s Nuclear Mindset

1st Place, Junior Group Website Category, 2013

The Gentleman’s Agreement: The Color Line Comes to Baseball

3rd Place, Senior Individual Documentary Category, 2013

The Seven Years’ War: Forging the Fate of a Continent

3rd  Place, Senior Group Documentary Category, 2013

Loving v. Virginia: No Longer a Black and White Story

1st Place, Senior Individual Website Category, 2013

The Lattimer Massacre: A Turning Point in Labor and Ethnic History

1st Place, Senior Group Website, 2013

Copernican Heliocentrism and the Dawn of Modern Science

Your Contributions Will:

  • Help cover costs for Pennsylvania students attending the national contest at the University of Maryland in College Park.
  • Assist with the provision of food and housing for more than 120 volunteers who make the State Contest possible.
  • Help keep student costs from rising in the future.

All contributors are welcome to attend the NHD in PA State Contest on May 12 and 13, 2014, at Millersville University, Millersville, PA, and will receive recognition as NHD in PA supporters.

Every dollar counts!  If we do not reach our entire goal, you can rest assured that your contribution will still be used to provide an outstanding educational experience for students.

Why Contribute?

National History Day in Pennsylvania is much more than a series of contests, it's an approach to history education that changes the way students see the world.  

NHD in PA students are:

  • Critical thinkers who learn to sort and evaluate information and how to develop and support reasoned, evidence based arguments.
  • Independent learners with excellent research skills, time management and organizational skills, and the ability to consult with and integrate information from experts.
  • Great communicators capable of clearly explaining complex ideas to a broad audience using a broad variety of techniques.
  • Hard working and motivated individuals who deserve a chance to continue to develop through this outstanding program.

The NHD program was the subject of a 2010 study by Rockman et al that confirmed the benefits of the program.  Click here to see the results of the study.

Choose Your Level of Sponsorship

We offer 11 different sponsorship levels to fit any budget.  Each level is named for a famous Pennsylvanian and comes with its own perks and types of donor recognition.

Sponsors interested in supporting NHD in PA at higher levels should contact us at 717-258-1102 or eddirector@armyheritage.org to discuss additional sponsorship opportunities.

Learn More About NHD in PA

National History Day in Pennsylvania Website

National History Day, Inc. Website

More about NHD from the History Channel

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to make a donation at this time, there are other ways to help.  You can:

  • Spread the word by sharing information with friends and family, or anyone you think might be interested in helping out through social media, email, word of mouth, or any other way you can think of.
  • Serve as a contest volunteer.  We need 120+ volunteers to make the State Contest happen.  Contact us at 717-258-1102 or eddirector@armyheritage.org to find out more about volunteering.
  • Tell everyone you can about NHD in PA.  Tell teachers, students, state and local officials, and anyone who might want to know more about NHD in PA.

YOU CAN MAKE A DIFFERENCE TODAY!


(Video Courtesy of National History Day, Inc. - www.nhd.org)

story:
Hello my name is Marisa Castro! I am a first year high school teacher in San Francisco.

I made a decision to become a high school teacher because I want to be the teacher I never had in school.  I am reaching out to my lovely community for help.  My students need school supplies and a classroom that reflects their life experiences.  I want to empower my students by giving them access to technology in my classroom. The internet has become the most powerful information sharing tool on our universe, all of which is but a click away.  Here is a list of items that I would like for my students to have in their classroom: 

1. Da-lite Projector Screen 

2. Logitech, Inc Products - Speaker System, 25 Watts, 1 Subwoofer, 2 Satellite Speakers, BK 

3. Linksys - Wireless-N Router with 4-Port Ethernet Switch 

I will use your money to buy the above-mentioned items and also teacher/student supplies (printer, paper, folders, dry erase markers etc).  I can use all the help, anything helps.  This project is for my students and our future generations.  I want to use media in all its forms in my classroom-video, music, presentation software, film and photography.  Honestly, I not only want to teach my students lessons they will never forget but I also want to give them an unforgettable technological experience in my classroom.  

If you can't help with money then please share my page!  I also accept donations of school supplies.  

Suggested Donations: 

1. HP LaserJet Pro P1102w Printer (1)

http://www.officemax.com/technology/printers/laser-printers/product-prod4220066?R=23422690&ssp=true

2. HP 85A (CE285D) Black LaserJet Dual Print Cartridge (2)

http://www.officemax.com/technology/ink-toner-r...

3. Crayola Washable Broad Line Markers Classpack, 200 Colored Markers (1)

http://www.officemax.com/brands/crayola/product-prod3291298

4. Crayola Crayons Classpack, 16 Colors, 800 ct. (1)

http://www.officemax.com/brands/crayola/product-prod2041413

5. Westcott Kid's Scissors with Microban Protection, 5" Blunt (40) 

http://www.officemax.com/office-supplies/school-supplies%20/scissors-trimmers/scissors/product-prod2940263

6. Boise X-9 Multiuse Copy Paper

http://www.officemax.com/office-supplies/paper/copy-multipurpose-paper/product-ARS21008?cm_sp=sbp-_-generic-_-paperspb1

7. X-Acto Mighty Mite Electric Pencil Sharpener (1)

http://www.officemax.com/office-supplies/pens-pencils-markers/pencils/pencil-sharpeners/product-ARS24710

8. OfficeMax Colored File Folders, 1/3 Cut, Letter, 100/Box (1)

http://www.officemax.com/office-supplies/file-folders-accessories/file-folders/colored-file-folders/product-ARS21674


Much Love,

Castro

story:
This is me, and my cause:

I may not have a slick, hip video to introduce my cause, but what I do have is a type of cause that I think many can relate to: to realize your dream, you often need that initial push, those people who believe in you, and that community that is willing to invest in you.
I have loved music, and teaching music, since I used to line up my stuffed animals and conduct them (I would say, "Hit it, boys!"). Since then, I have earned a Bachelor's degree in Music Theory and Composition and a Master's degree in Musicology. I am passionate about journeying with young college students to develop a relationship to all kinds of music, and most importantly, to join in society's conversation that happens in and through the arts. However, to do this, you need a doctorate. And to get a doctorate, you have to get it somewhere. To get in somewhere, you must apply to many places. Application costs around $100 (give or take, depending on the school) PER APPLICATION! Yikes! I haven't even started my career, so what's a poor student to do?

Here's where you come in!

I am applying to 8 schools, with the lowest application fee at $75, the rest between $100-150. $900 is the approximate amount that I will need to pay for these application fees. It will actually cost a bit more than that, with transcripts and sending my GRE scores, but at the risk of burdening friends, I wanted to keep it under a grand. 

If every one of my Facebook friends gave $5, I would more than make it! 

So, when you donate to my cause, your money will be used immediately (as all my applications are due by mid-January!) to pay for each of my applications. With my net cast this wide, it is very likely that I will get into one of my schools, and it will be because of YOUR support!

The Impact:

At this risk of sounding self-aggrandizing, I think that academia needs people who are passionate and who care deeply about teaching. I am one of those people! I might not be able to change the entire world, but I can make a difference in my students' lives by providing an atmosphere of learning, community, and cultural engagement, rather than letting them just go through the motions for a grade.

Ways to help :)

I understand that $5 is a stretch for some, but you can still help! Get my story out there, share this page, and send me good thoughts/prayers!

story:
This is my campaign to raise funds for my university fees.

I am currently in 1st semester of my 3rd year in Bachelor of Education degree  Our university education system here in Kenya takes four years of eight semesters.

I am truly hoping with your help I will finally be able to pay my remaining four semesters, get my first degree and then be able to get a good job which will enable me pay for my higher degrees. I know everybody struggles sometimes, but I also know that some people do need a new start, a little push to help them.

What We Need & What You Get

I am hoping to raise $5,000. This will allow me to finally get a degree. Every dollar I receive will go towards my college tuition and every dollar counts.

The Impact

My university education has always meant the world to me and I never thought I would go through such a rough patch in my life causing me to feel depressed and down on myself. Any amount of money would help me. 



Other Ways You Can Help

All I can ask of you if you can not help me is to:

Ask you to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.

Remind you to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Share it on any social sites that you visit


Any amount will help, thank you.

story:
The Details:
 
In 2011, I had the amazing opportunity of traveling throughout SE Asia. The particular experience of Cambodia opened my eyes, my mind, and my heart to a group of people with determination and grit, a world I knew very little about, and a recent history that not only shocked me, but has forever changed me. After 2 years, I will go back to Cambodia to work with orphaned children with the hope of giving them some education, exposure, and the confidence to go out and reverse the fate that many cannot. Whitney Webb, one of my closest and dearest friends, has put together this trip. She volunteered at the organization, ACODO, a few years ago when she was traveling in SE Asia. ACODO is mainly an orphanage but they do educational outreach through the country and have hopes/plans to expand. The 76 kids living in the orphanage come from pretty awful backgrounds (the effects of the Cambodian genocide are far from gone and child sex trafficking is a huge issue in the region) BUT the orphanage is a very happy, safe, and positive place. http://www.acodo.org/.
 
The Volunteer Work:
 
Our plan is to volunteer for a week at the orphanage (both in Siem Reap and Phnom Penh), spending time with the kids, and running a day or two camp for the teens based on entrepreneurship and personal finance. As many of you know, for the past four years I lived in South Korea while working as an independent educator and traveling throughout Asia; Whitney was working and traveling in post conflict countries in Africa, primarily Rwanda, with a focus on micro-finance loans. We have both seen a lack of entrepreneurial drive and financial fluency overall with the children in developing countries. There are several organizations promoting entrepreneurship in young adults, but from our current work in the United States, we have seen the huge impact that these ideas make when planted in the minds of children and teens. It's easy for all of us to take for granted the mentors (parents, teachers) and inspiration we get from seeing everyday people do extraordinary things. These kids don't have that exposure, and we want to try this out by bringing in some local small business owners in various industries to talk to the kids. Since starting a business is much easier said than done, we want to introduce the concepts of savings, budgeting, and micro-loans to the teens as well. The plan is to work with a local micro-finance bank who can send a local representative to speak, and we'll work with them to create some basic curriculum for us to run. Regardless of if these kids start a business, we think the basic financial ideas will help them as they leave the orphanage for independent lives.
 
The Specifics:
 
I am asking family, friends, friends of the family and the families of friends to help me out with the monetary portion of this venture. Not only will I be raising money for the orphanage and the cost of volunteering and running the camp, but also for the cost of the flight to get me out there: my goal is to raise $3,000.
 
Please feel free to email or call me with any questions or if you know anyone in Siem Reap who may want to help out or mentor the kids. And please pass along my info to any friends / family who may want to help or get involved with ACODO at some point.
 
 
Thank you so much for taking the time, and any help you can offer!

story:
Background:

Hello! We are Hearts of Gold, a Cornerstone group from the University of Central Florida. Our group has partnered with Kids Beating Cancer, a non-profit organization, this fall semester to help further their mission.

(Our Cornerstone group members)

Kids Beating Cancer Mission:

Their mission is to “increase access to treatment for children with cancer, leukemia, and other life threatening diseases in need of a marrow or stem cell transplant by funding the cost to identify compatible donors and uninsured medical expenses, while providing support for families as they face the challenging journey toward a cure.” 

To learn more about Kids Beating Cancer check out the link below:

clickhere

Transplant Center Programs:

“My Room,” creates a safe and fun place for a child during treatment. “A themed hospital room is customized according to each child’s preference. For example, Disney princess, or Spiderman complete with bedding, games, and toys. The transplant process is lengthy, and ‘My Room,’ helps create a comfortable and safe room he or she will be calling home for possibly many months.”

Where will the Donations go?

ALL donations will go directly to Kids Beating Cancer. These donations will be used to create a personalized room in Florida Hospital where the child will be staying during their transplant and recovery period.

The impact you make:

It can be a difficult time for a child and their family during treatment. Kids Beating Cancer provides essential support to these families. The journey is challenging, but YOU can make a difference in a child’s life.

Other ways to help:

-Spread the word.  Share this site to all of your family, friends, and co-workers.

-To learn more about Kids Beating Cancer, visit their homepage:  KidsBeatingCancerHomepage

Hello! We are
Hearts of Gold, a Cornerstone group from the University of Central Florida. Our
group has partnered with Kids Beating Cancer, a non-profit organization, this
fall semester to help further their mission. 



(Our Cornerstone group members)
Kids Beating
Cancer Mission:
Their mission is
to “increase access to treatment for children with cancer, leukemia, and other
life threatening diseases in need of a marrow or stem cell transplant by
funding the cost to identify compatible donors and uninsured medical expenses,
while providing support for families as they face the challenging journey
toward a cure.” 
To learn more about Kids Beating Cancer check out the link below:
clickhere
Transplant
Center Programs:
“My Room,” creates
a safe and fun place for a child during treatment. “A themed hospital room is
customized according to each child’s preference. For example, Disney princess,
or Spiderman complete with bedding, games, and toys. The transplant process is
lengthy, and ‘My Room,’ helps create a comfortable and safe room he or she will
be calling home for possibly many months.”
Where will the
Donations go?
ALL donations
will go directly to Kids Beating Cancer. These donations will be used to create
a personalized room in Florida Hospital where the child will be staying during
their transplant and recovery period. 
The impact you
make:
It can be a
difficult time for a child and their family during treatment. Kids Beating
Cancer provides essential support to these families. The journey is
challenging, but YOU can make a difference in a child’s life.
Other ways to
help:
-Spread the word.
 Share this site to all of your family,
friends, and co-workers. 
-To learn more
about Kids Beating Cancer, visit their homepage:  KidsBeatingCancerHomepage

story:
About the Greater Hudson Promise Neighborhood

The Greater Hudson Promise Neighborhood Project (GHPN) was founded 2010 when a group of local agencies came together to envision and plan a community-based educational program. In 2011 GHPN, through lead organization Catholic Charities of Columbia and Greene Counties, received a planning grant through the US Department of Education, one of only 15 communities nationwide to be awarded the grant.

GHPN is modeled after the highly successful Harlem Children's Zone, and works to create community-school partnerships to better support our community's children and their families. To achieve this, GHPN works on a cradle to career pipeline of education, which includes programs for children and their families beginning with expecting parents and early childhood learning, in-school and out-of-school programs and college-preparatory programs.

Through these programs, GHPN works to address the educational disparity that exists within the Hudson City School District. This disparity is shown in both the economic and education status of students and their families. Within the 67 square miles that make up the school district, including both rural and urban areas, 49.9% of families with children under the age of five live below the poverty line and, as of 2009, 103 of the 1,900 children in the school district were homeless. Only 57% of the district's students entered kindergarten with the appropriate skills, and the district’s 61% graduation rate, well below the state-standard graduation rate of 80%.

 

How You Can Make an Impact

With our planning period coming to an end, we are seeking support and financial contributions from our community to keep GHPN growing and thriving. Your support will enable us to offer programs such as Families of Promise, a six week parenting class for new and expecting parents, and to offer new pilot programs such as Hudson POPS, a fatherhood initiative for fathers and their children in the Hudson City School District. Our contribution will allow us to continue to implement our pipeline of education programs to support and encourage our students so that they will grow to be successful in high school, college and career.

 

Can't Donate?

You can still be a GHPN champion! Please help us to spread the word! Here are some simple ways you can get involved:
1. Like GHPN on Facebook
2. Share a link to our campaign via email, Facebook, Twitter or your blog
3. Talk to your friends and family GHPN 
4. Contact us to find out about volunteer opportunities

story:
Program Goal: Girls in rural India dream of continuing their education after high school, but family finances are often not enough to cover the costs of books, school fees and transportation. At the same time, many girls lack the parental guidance and community support to help them excel in a post-secondary educational setting. This project, part of a three-year initiative, will cover one year of higher education costs for 50 girls in Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan.

To ensure successful completion of the students’ first year of post-secondary education, your gift will provide for basic enrollment and related expenses, including travel costs, room and board and study materials. It will also cover pre-admission sessions, course and career guidance and life skills training, all of which are needed for a successful academic career.

Expected Results: This project will fund the first year of post-secondary education for 50 girls in rural India, giving them a solid start toward completing their degrees. The scholarship will include pre-admission counseling, enrollment and exam fees and course and career guidance to prepare these young women to continue their higher education. 

This pilot initiative will ensure that girls in Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan receive the assistance they need to enroll in their first year of post-secondary school. ChildFund is working to secure further funding so that these girls can continue and complete their degrees.

How you can help: Make a contribution of any size, share our appeal on Facebook with your friends, tweet about it, pin it onto your boards on Pinterest, share it on Google+ and tell all of your friends about the campaign!


About ChildFund International: ChildFund International is a global child development and protection agency serving more than 18.1 million children and family members in 30 countries. For 75 years, we have helped the world's deprived, excluded and vulnerable children survive and thrive to reach their full potential and become leaders of enduring change. As a member of ChildFund Alliance we create supportive environments in which children can flourish.

story:
My Holiday in Cameroon - December 2013!!!

Going careless on vacation in Cameroon is Egoistic Tourism.

Going in charge of carrying a message of hope to the African children is a tourism of solidarity.

I will spend a month working in the orphanage of CAJEN created by Maman MAXI, a school teacher and an orphan herself.

CAJEN center, is welcoming orphans , from 3 to 17 years old, to enable them to follow education in a nearby public school in Douala suburb : It has been presented to me by my Cameroonian friend, herself raised with a European education and now working in Montreal, yet has not forgotten her wonderful country of origin.

Africa is not only a huge market and a huge exporter of basic produces and a rich field of valuable minerals ores. Africa was the cradle of European civilization. Africa is now the widest basin of cultural and intellectual human resources thanks to its high birth rate if we contribute heavily to educate and train them.

To channel fund to educate our African young kids is the best insurance for our future.

 

Give 10-20-50 even 100 $CAD, I will deliver them directly to Maman MAXI hands.

Make a maximal gift to Maman MAXI and her children.

To give directly to the Center , is to be sure that your gifts will be spent usefully without overheads of NGOs.

To give directly is to give more, it is creating a personal and cultural  link, it is delivering a message of hope.

The children of Maman MAXI are extending their hands, thirsty to learn. Help them proceed from elementary towards higher education.

I thank you on their behalf and You will receive at my return a souvenir of my visit to CAJEN.

story:
Who We Are:

TomTod Ideas started in the fall of 2012 as a platform for middle school students to launch their dreams to change the world for good. In the last year, we’ve worked with over 75 young leaders through a variety of venues, to engage their imaginations and launch their dreams into action.

What We Do:

In the coming year, we’re going to start distributing our first ever scholarship funding through Idea:X. Our most extensive program, Idea:X is a full-tilt innovation incubator, engaging students in a rigorous process that fuels their dreams, centered on the common good, all the way from concept through to actualization. This past year we had 3 different projects take flight, focused on issues of bullying, Down Syndrome, and clean water. In the coming year, we’re aiming to double that, while rewarding students for their diligent work with scholarship money toward post-secondary education. That’s where you come in…

Generosity Multiplied:

Starting on #GivingTuesday (December 3rd), we’re raising money to give away to students as scholarship money next year. 100% of what you give will be earmarked specifically for scholarships for Idea:X students.

Our goal is to give away over $15,000 in scholarship awards in 2014 to middle school innovators, and your generosity can help us to achieve that. Each dollar you give will fund the imaginations of the future as they pursue further education.

But it gets even better! Thanks to the commitment of our board, every dollar given Tuesday will be matched, up to $3500! Additionally, through Indiegogo’s #GivingTuesday promotion, every $20 that’s given will generate an additional $1 for our scholarship fund. While our campaign will run through the end of the month, this Indiegogo match is good for only 1 day (December 3). 

That means your gift of $100 will become $205…a $1000 gift becomes $2050 gift!

Spread The Word:

Beyond giving (thanks!), we need help spreading the word and inviting others who believe in middle schools students and the power of imaginative innovation to join in. You can use the share buttons included in the campaign to let your friends, family, and co-workers know. Thanks for your investment in tomorrow, today.

-----

*Indiegogo’s $1 to $20 match is only good for #GivingTuesday (December 3rd). 

TomTod Ideas Inc is a non-profit 501(c)3 organization, based out of Canton, Ohio. Find more information at www.tomtodideas.org or on the social media channel of your choice: @tomtodideas

story:
Boosting Entrepreneurial Empowerment in Central America (BEE) Program

Welcome to the Global Alliance for Entrepreneurship and Business Development (Global AEBD) Indiegogo page. We are a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization dedicated to the vision that entrepreneurship is our most effective and powerful tool in the challenging fight against poverty, unemployment, and underemployment.

Global AEBD’s current primary focus is the developing world, and we are working on our first major international project. It is designed to benefit Central America, specifically the countries of Guatemala, Honduras, El Salvador, and Nicaragua.

In Central America, 50% of the population (or 10 million people) still live in poverty. Of those who belong to the labor force, 50% are underemployed. These problems are strongly related to the fact that 80% of their micro, small and medium enterprises collapse in less than five years after being initiated. Such distressing conditions often ruin the lives of entire families and deteriorate already precarious social situations.

Consistent with recommendations of relevant studies and research, Global AEBD intends to deliver an innovative, participatory, and sustainable approach to the challenging task of enhancing both the number and longevity of micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs) in the Central American region.

Our project’s banner is “Boosting Entrepreneurial Empowerment in Central America” (BEE). The program will bring together Central American and international organizations -- including prestigious educational institutions, business associations, and a large community of professionals -- concerned with improving entrepreneurial skills and generating opportunities in the region. BEE will simultaneously engage relevant people and organizations in a strong and systematic effort to foster entrepreneurship and management skills, and to continuously generate fresh avenues for MSMEs entrepreneurs to thrive.

Specifically, our Global AEBD BEE project will:

  1. Build and sustain a web-based entrepreneurial hub
  2. Facilitate formal and informal entrepreneurship education programs for MSMEs with institutional partners
  3. Enable mentoring and coaching by kind and seasoned entrepreneurs and intrapreneurs
  4. Create fresh avenues for relevant peer-to-peer knowledge and information sharing
  5. Provide fresh opportunities for international business-to-business networking

In this manner, the BEE program will bring about several important direct benefits to prospective and current MSMEs entrepreneurs, notably, the reduction of risks associated with a lack of appropriate knowledge and connections for business startup and sustainability.

In addition to bringing the online hub to life, the Global AEBD team is outreaching potential operational partners both in Central America and in other parts of the world. This includes not just people and institutions concerned with entrepreneurial education, skill building and development, but also, and not less important, organizations -- such as regional telecenters -- who may help potential and current MSMEs entrepreneurs to improve their digital-literacy skills.  

We already have a number of positive responses from some prestigious institutions, including:

  • The Universidad Americana in Nicaragua
  • George Mason University in the US
  • The Asociación Conexión al Desarrollo de El Salvador
  • The Universidad Thomas More in Nicaragua
  • The Latin American Consorcio Red de Educacion a Distancia (CREAD).

Our current crowdfunding campaign focuses on resources that are very much needed to successfully complete our cutting-edge online hub. This platform will be based on Ruby-on-Rails -- a highly versatile, modern, powerful, and scalable web framework, which is used in well-known and robust sites, including Twitter. Following all relevant development stages, our Web 2.0 mobile-friendly website will include the components and functionality depicted in the following diagram:

As indicated above, generous and able volunteers are currently granting their valuable time and skills to build the BEE online hub, and to attract relevant program partners. Still, the success of our Global AEBD IT project requires financial resources in the amount of $120,000 to effectively and efficiently bring together a fully operational and interactive web-platform, including the execution of all development stages through beta testing and quality control.

Therefore, we encourage you to kindly donate towards our Global AEBD cause and share the link to this webpage with family, friends, acquaintances, neighbors, colleagues, and kindred entrepreneurial spirits.

Global AEBD is offering a Referral Rewards Contest! The winner will be the person who has the most referrals using the sharing buttons on this page. The winner gets a backpack full of surprise gifts!

Please keep in mind that your support will make a wealth of difference in the battle against poverty and unemployment in Honduras, El Salvador, Guatemala and Nicaragua, and will bring about lasting positive impacts for thousands of Central American families.

And remember that since we are a 501(c)3 nonprofit, every dollar you invest in our wonderful BEE program is fully tax deductible.

story:
Short Summary

This campaign has been set up to raise funds to complete a series of on-line video tutorials to help teach media students techniques in video production using technology they have at hand, such as mobiles phones and home computers.

It is hard to belief but over the past 12 years I have taught 2040 students the art and creative process of video production. Each year the students have produced over 20 or so videos per class. The problem has been that much of the classroom experience has been theoretical and the practical aspect has been done outside classes without a teacher.

One of my most successful projects with students was 'Silent Whispers':


The students worked on a range of scripts, then mashed them together to form the story seen above. They recorded the process as part of a short documentary, sharing what they experienced and how it effected their understanding of video production.


Many of the students seen in the video have gone on to study Higher National Diplomas, Honors Degrees and even Masters Degree in Media Production. Several have come back to work on projects I have developed such as digital feature films, documentaries and short promotional videos.

Students learn at different paces and have different styles of learning. Classrooms can be boring as many want to get stuck into the practical side of the video courses. Many preferred to watch something on YouTube or play computer games, especially if the tutor is dealing with another student's problems.

Video tutorials allow students to learn what they want, and when they want. Whenever possible I would produce a video to help them learn a piece of software. However, with more demands for producing paperwork and ticking boxes, less and less time was available to produce the necessary video tutorials.

The problem I found with many video tutorials on-line was that they were not produced by experienced video professionals or educationalists, so often crucial pieces of information would get left out causing frustration.

YouTree.TV Limited is a small company set-up to produce on-line video courses, allowing me to mix together 30 years experience working in television and video production with 12 years experience, working in further education, teaching media production.

The first phase is to produce a series of twenty-two video tutorials demonstrating the basic principles of video production, using technology close at hand, such as mobile phone and compact cameras, with simple editing tools. This campaign is being launched to help complete the first series of video tutorials, of which two can be seen above.

The second phase is to produce a series of fifty video tutorials with more comprehensive information.

Alongside the video tutorials, I am working with media industry professionals and Creative Skillset in Northern Ireland to set up a five-day workshop that will help graduate students build skills for working in industry. This combination of on-line video tutorials and face-to-face practical workshops will help build a strong platform of blended-learning, initially in Northern Ireland, but eventually throughout the UK.

Your help in raising fund in this first campaign, will allow me to complete the first 17 video tutorials which will include developing ideas, how to use a range of camera technologies, shooting techniques to build a story, transferring movies clips from camera to computer, editing techniques on both Mac and PC, and uploading onto the Internet.

With my experience in television and education, I have a wealth of material to share with passionate digital film-makers. Using video is an ideal platform to achieve this, allowing students to work at their own pace. This is also a shared experience and collaborators have an opportunity to suggest additional courses that YouTree.TV can produce after this set of videos are complete.

Who is George Kingsnorth?

I studied for a Higher National Diploma in Film & Television at Bournemouth and Poole College of Art & Design between 1980 - 1983. By 1984, I was working in Manchester on animation and freelancing as an assistant film editor. Towards the end of that year I was employed by BBC Northern Ireland, assisting in the editing of 16mm film productions, both drama and documentary. By 1988, I was editing video productions for Anglia Television in Norwich, England.

With my young family, I moved back to Northern Ireland a year later to work freelance on a range of broadcast and corporate productions both on film and video. By 2002, I had completed nearly 200 projects both in production and post-production

Later that year, I began lecturing in video production at the University of Central England in Birmingham to undergraduate and Masters degree students. In 2004, I returned home to Newry to teach in Further & Higher Education and began production of my first digital feature film, 'Fiddler's Walk' which was crewed by many of his students. Five years later, a group of my National Diploma students encouraged me to produce a second feature film, which involves both live-action and animation, with nearly 50 students helping in pre-production, production and post-production.

Although my main passion is film-making, my second passion is studying. After completing a Higher National Diploma in Film & Television, I studied with the Open University to gain a Bachelor of Arts. Since then I have achieved a Postgraduate Certificate in Humanities, a Postgraduate Certificate in Digital Television Technology and Production, a Master of Arts in Media Studies, and most recently completed a Master of Education focusing on blended-learning.

What We Need & What You Get

The following is a breakdown of what we need to complete the videos and what you get for supporting this campaign:

  • To complete the 17 video tutorials I need raise £12,000.
  • The funds will be used to research each video tutorial, design relevant animation to highlight specific areas in the tutorials, record video demonstrations, record voice-overs, edit the materials together and upload on to Udemy.com
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • If the entire goal is achieve, it is hoped that the 17 tutorials will be complete by the end of July 2014. If the entire goal is not achieve this target date will moved to later in the year as other projects will take priority to keep the company running. If more than the entire goal is achieve, the funds will be used to develop further video-tutorials as part of the second phase of producing a more in-depth course of 50 videos.
  • So far, I have invested funds to purchase computers, software, cameras and accessories. The additional costs include hiring freelancers to help film material an individual cannot achieve on their own. These funds will also help speed up the editing process and produce opportunities to create 'making of..' documentary footage.

The Impact

I have always enjoyed film-making but by sharing what I have learned with others and encouraging them to work with me on projects has been more rewarding. Your contribution will allow me to work with others to produce these tutorials and make them more relevant to the needs of my target audience, enthusiastic film-makings with limited tools but grate stories to tell.

Your contribution to this campaign will help in the following ways:

  • All the generation of the training video to be produced far sooner.
  • Provide opportunities for local film-makers to get involved in the project.
  • Help to build a local community of film-makers who want the share their experiences so other can learn the craft of digital film-making.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't worry if you are unable to contribute financially. Other ways you can help is to:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Make suggestions towards the types of film-making tutorials you would be interested in learning about for future courses.

Thanks for spending the time looking at my campaign and I hope you will join us along the way towards a successful conclusion.
story_txt:
Short SummaryThis campaign has been set up to raise funds to complete a series of on-line video tutorials to help teach media students techniques in video production using technology they have at hand, such as mobiles phones and home computers.It is hard to belief but over the past 12 years I have taught 2040 students the art and creative process of video production. Each year the students have produced over 20 or so videos per class. The problem has been that much of the classroom experience has been theoretical and the practical aspect has been done outside classes without a teacher.One of my most successful projects with students was 'Silent Whispers':The students worked on a range of scripts, then mashed them together to form the story seen above. They recorded the process as part of a short documentary, sharing what they experienced and how it effected their understanding of video production.Many of the students seen in the video have gone on to study Higher National Diplomas, Honors Degrees and even Masters Degree in Media Production. Several have come back to work on projects I have developed such as digital feature films, documentaries and short promotional videos.

Students learn at different paces and have different styles of learning. Classrooms can be boring as many want to get stuck into the practical side of the video courses. Many preferred to watch something on YouTube or play computer games, especially if the tutor is dealing with another student's problems.Video tutorials allow students to learn what they want, and when they want. Whenever possible I would produce a video to help them learn a piece of software. However, with more demands for producing paperwork and ticking boxes, less and less time was available to produce the necessary video tutorials.The problem I found with many video tutorials on-line was that they were not produced by experienced video professionals or educationalists, so often crucial pieces of information would get left out causing frustration.YouTree.TV Limited is a small company set-up to produce on-line video courses, allowing me to mix together 30 years experience working in television and video production with 12 years experience, working in further education, teaching media production.

The first phase is to produce a series of twenty-two video tutorials demonstrating the basic principles of video production, using technology close at hand, such as mobile phone and compact cameras, with simple editing tools. This campaign is being launched to help complete the first series of video tutorials, of which two can be seen above.
The second phase is to produce a series of fifty video tutorials with more comprehensive information.

Alongside the video tutorials, I am working with media industry professionals and Creative Skillset in Northern Ireland to set up a five-day workshop that will help graduate students build skills for working in industry. This combination of on-line video tutorials and face-to-face practical workshops will help build a strong platform of blended-learning, initially in Northern Ireland, but eventually throughout the UK.

Your help in raising fund in this first campaign, will allow me to complete the first 17 video tutorials which will include developing ideas, how to use a range of camera technologies, shooting techniques to build a story, transferring movies clips from camera to computer, editing techniques on both Mac and PC, and uploading onto the Internet.With my experience in television and education, I have a wealth of material to share with passionate digital film-makers. Using video is an ideal platform to achieve this, allowing students to work at their own pace. This is also a shared experience and collaborators have an opportunity to suggest additional courses that YouTree.TV can produce after this set of videos are complete.Who is George Kingsnorth?
I studied for a Higher National Diploma in Film & Television at Bournemouth and Poole College of Art & Design between 1980 - 1983. By 1984, I was working in Manchester on animation and freelancing as an assistant film editor. Towards the end of that year I was employed by BBC Northern Ireland, assisting in the editing of 16mm film productions, both drama and documentary. By 1988, I was editing video productions for Anglia Television in Norwich, England. With my young family, I moved back to Northern Ireland a year later to work freelance on a range of broadcast and corporate productions both on film and video. By 2002, I had completed nearly 200 projects both in production and post-productionLater that year, I began lecturing in video production at the University of Central England in Birmingham to undergraduate and Masters degree students. In 2004, I returned home to Newry to teach in Further & Higher Education and began production of my first digital feature film, 'Fiddler's Walk' which was crewed by many of his students. Five years later, a group of my National Diploma students encouraged me to produce a second feature film, which involves both live-action and animation, with nearly 50 students helping in pre-production, production and post-production.Although my main passion is film-making, my second passion is studying. After completing a Higher National Diploma in Film & Television, I studied with the Open University to gain a Bachelor of Arts. Since then I have achieved a Postgraduate Certificate in Humanities, a Postgraduate Certificate in Digital Television Technology and Production, a Master of Arts in Media Studies, and most recently completed a Master of Education focusing on blended-learning.What We Need & What You GetThe following is a breakdown of what we need to complete the videos and what you get for supporting this campaign:To complete the 17 video tutorials I need raise £12,000.The funds will be used to research each video tutorial, design relevant animation to highlight specific areas in the tutorials, record video demonstrations, record voice-overs, edit the materials together and upload on to Udemy.comTell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!If the entire goal is achieve, it is hoped that the 17 tutorials will be complete by the end of July 2014. If the entire goal is not achieve this target date will moved to later in the year as other projects will take priority to keep the company running. If more than the entire goal is achieve, the funds will be used to develop further video-tutorials as part of the second phase of producing a more in-depth course of 50 videos.So far, I have invested funds to purchase computers, software, cameras and accessories. The additional costs include hiring freelancers to help film material an individual cannot achieve on their own. These funds will also help speed up the editing process and produce opportunities to create 'making of..' documentary footage. 
The ImpactI have always enjoyed film-making but by sharing what I have learned with others and encouraging them to work with me on projects has been more rewarding. Your contribution will allow me to work with others to produce these tutorials and make them more relevant to the needs of my target audience, enthusiastic film-makings with limited tools but grate stories to tell. Your contribution to this campaign will help in the following ways:
All the generation of the training video to be produced far sooner.
Provide opportunities for local film-makers to get involved in the project.
Help to build a local community of film-makers who want the share their experiences so other can learn the craft of digital film-making.
Other Ways You Can HelpDon't worry if you are unable to contribute financially. Other ways you can help is to:
Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
Use the Indiegogo share tools!
Make suggestions towards the types of film-making tutorials you would be interested in learning about for future courses.

Thanks for spending the time looking at my campaign and I hope you will join us along the way towards a successful conclusion.

story:
Advancing Social & Economic Prosperity For Youth Through the Study and Practice of Entrepreneurship

YouthBiz is investing in a new generation of business owners, job creators and community leaders by helping them harness their passions, skills and dreams through entrepreneurship. We offer middle and high school youth a continuum of dedicated programming, both in and after school, and in partnership with a broad range of community partners, that challenges them to build entrepreneurial skills and habits through actual business ownership.

At YouthBiz, we are 100 percent dedicated to delivering robust, rigorous, youth-centered entrepreneurship education as well as individualized enterprise start-up and growth support. We go way beyond the business plan, incorporating real-world, dollar generating experience for all of our youth, year-round.

Aspiring Entrepreneurs

We help youth discover and develop their life-long entrepreneurial potential by concentrating on the building blocks of success – personal leadership, professional skills development, financial management and entrepreneurial thinking. The curriculum used is dynamic, rigorous and aligned to national entrepreneurship education standards.

Emerging Entrepreneurs

We bring entrepreneurship to life through intensive business ownership experience. Participants work in teams to identify an entrepreneurial opportunity, prepare a business for launch, then run a profitable enterprise. Along the journey, young entrepreneurs work to develop independent business concepts that reflect and support their unique talents and interests.

Entrepreneurial Leaders

Where YouthBiz participants realize their entrepreneurial dreams and take ownership of their futures. This capstone program is completely tailored to, and driven by, the participant, offering access to the specific resources they need to maximize their success.

Results

A Model For Youth Employment 

Our work has been noticed and recognized by leading national foundations and media outlets. In 2013 we were named one of the national finalists in the JobRaising Challenge to highlight the most innovative, feasible, and scalable candidates from nonprofits in the country.

“It’s been just terrific to see the positive impact so many outstanding non-profit organizations like YouthBiz are having on the U.S. jobs market,” said Sally Osberg, president of the Skoll Foundation.  “The entrepreneurial finalists for this landmark competition are generating jobs, vitalizing communities, and transforming lives.”

Core Outcomes

It is our promise that all youth who successfully complete our programming will leave our organization with the following:

  • Increased income and earning potential

  • Increased academic achievement

  • Increased resiliency

  • Increased connection to community

Statistical Results to Date

The following measurements are used as indicators to track our progress to toward the above outcomes:

  • $1.5 million in youth earnings distributed

  • 100% academic enrollment or graduation

  • 1.5 point average GPA increase

  • Statistically significant increases in resiliency towards multiple risk factors by 95% of youth on The Resilience Scale, v 3.20, created by Gail M. Wagnild, RN, Phd.

story:
The Pitch

Hi! I'm Stewart and I'm Taylor and we live inside your Emagine-Nation!  We love to play games and connect with our friends.  And, we love to learn.  That's the part that our parents like the most.  We're trying to raise money to complete the world of your Emagine-Nation.com so you can create, play, and have fun while you learn. 

What's Emagine-Nation.com?

  • It's a new virtual world where kids can play, earn rewards for learning, complete webquests, create an avatar and go to virtual school with that avatar. 
  • It's a virtual campus with classrooms, cafeteria, gym, offices, and even a bathroom.
  • It's a social networking site where kids can connect with friends from all over the world...in a safe and secure way.
  • It's a Campus Store with thousands of hand-selected products for kids, parents, and educators.

We need your help to bring the world of Emagine-Nation.com to life for kids and parents everywhere.

What We Need & What You Get (It's the adults talking now!)

We've been working on this project for 7 years.  We are almost done and ready to launch.  The last part of our development includes all the social networking features.  This is where the challenge is...completing the social networking development in a way that allows kids to create and connect safely and securely.   We need your help to complete this project by October 31st and launch it by Thanksgiving, 2013. 

Why is Emagine-Nation.com Different Than Other Virtual Worlds?

Because it's focus is having fun while you learn. 

  • It's a safe and secure browser with a kid-friendly search engine.
  • There's a Project Wizard Room where you can create any project using all the latest technology.  Have fun and get stuff done.
  • There's a library with virtual resources, A Novel Idea Book Club, and more.
  • There are classrooms, a reward room, and more rooms than you can emagine!
  • There's even a bathroom where you can write graffiti on the wall...and NOT get in trouble!  You can even share your wall with friends.

Why Does The World Need Emagine-Nation.com?

The cultural context of children, teens, and families is changing at an exponential rate, especially when it comes to technology.  These changes leave kids facing a host of unprecedented problems for which there is no model to navigate by....and, few "every day" adults that understand. Technological advancements are outpacing our knowledge and preparedness for these changes.  And, kids certainly aren't contemplating the effects of social media, social interaction, and cognitive development has on their lives.  That's our job.  And, how do we do that job if we don't understand these issues ourselves?  We look around to see who is forward-thinking enough to have at least posed the questions.  And, we have....for 7 years.

There has been much research on what it will take for a student to be successful in the 21st century.  We are currently clear that success will depend on specific life skills and specific competencies such as information literacy, technology literacy, creativity and innovation, critical thinking and problem solving, communication and collaboration, and more.  There is no second guessing what it will take to be successful....we KNOW.  And, we can do a better job of helping our digital kids be ready. 

We have spent 7 years designing an environment where kids can learn, engage, and create in a safe and secure way.  We have spent time analyzing the threats that kids face online.  We have engaged kids who are the real experts in this area and we have incorporated their experiences.  Now, we need to finish the development that involves the actual interraction between kids in and out of our world.  Kids will be able to create and engage in learning and sharing without parents having to worry about technological dangers that they may be facing.  We know what we need to do and it's a massive undertaking.  Now we need to develop it and incorporate it into the world of their Emagine-Nation.com.  Please help us bring this world to life by donating to the project.  THANK YOU for helping us help them.

How Can You Get Involved?

Bring your own Emagine-Nation to our world, and the Emagine-Nation of your child, and learn, play, and share.  Donating money will help us finish the social  networking development so that your kids can use their Emagine-Nation to create, earn rewards, update their status on their very own social networking wall and share with their friends around the world.

What do you get?

  • The knowledge that you've helped to finish a stunning virtual environment that focuses on learning in new and engaging ways.
  • The knowledge that your kids will learn in a game-like environment that captures their Emagine-Nation and keeps them wanting more.
  • The knowledge that you've provided your child with the latest 21st century technology tools that they need to get to the head of the class....in school and in life.

If you are a business...

We have a special offer for businesses that will allow you to not only take advantage of our crowdfunding opportunities and perks but also maintain a presence in the world of Emagine-Nation.com as a prominently displayed advertiser, sponsor, or partner.  Get in on the ground floor by contributing to our campaign and we will create a very special offer for in-world promotion.  

See our media kit or email us at campaign@emagine-nation.com.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, we understand.  Please help us by:

  • Getting the word out to your friends and family.
  • And, don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.  Help us help your child learn and play in fun while getting stuff done.  Help us to finish the development of this stunning virtual world so that they can enjoy the social networking features that brings the world to them.

Our Story

We are a team of licensed school psychologists, certified education specialists, licensed mental health professionals, and certified coaches.  We have worked with kids and families for over 30 years.  Seven years ago we asked ourselves a pivotal question - "how can we leverage what we know and make it available beyond our local borders?"  We had a dream...and, that dream was that we could help to close the gap between what students need to learn with how they learn today - with multiple intelligences and literacies, using technology as a platform of collaboration and engagement with their own process.  Our dream was that, if students were provided the right environment, that their emaginations would catch fire and that they would re-engage in their own learning process because they were engaged in the technology tools they came pre-wired to use.  Our dream was that kids would co-create their own reality with adults and educators trained in the new educational and life landscape that the kids exist within.  The rules have changed and we need to be prepared by giving our kids the environment with which to navigate successfully. That's our dream and we are asking you to participate in that dream.

About Us (click the image below)

For More Information, Contact Us!

  • Toll-Free: 1 (855) EMAGINE
  • Email:  campaign@emagine-nation.com
  • Web: www.emagine-nation.com
  • Facebook:  www.facebook.com/myemaginenation
  • Twitter:  www.twitter.com/myemaginenation
  • YouTube:  www.youtube.com/user/myemaginenation
  • Instagram: www.instagram.com/myemaginenation

Stretch Goals

If we receive more than our goal, this is what we plan
to do in the next phases of Emagine-Nation.com!

$125,000  That's our goal.  Thank you!

$175,000  Our Older World!  Did you know that we've been working on an "older" world for kids transitioning in age?  Yes, we have!  For $175,000 we will bring that world to life. With a medieval-like campus, ravens, and gargoyles, this world appeals to kids 11-13 and up.  When we reach this goal, we will introduce this world to the world!

$250,000  Added In-World Features.  We have so many designed features to add once we reach this goal:  an electronic backpack, bathroom graffiti wall for sharing, and even more avatar customizations.  Reaching this goal will allow us to bring these features into the world for even more fun and learning.

$500,000  Multiple Platforms.  Once we reach this goal, we will launch the world of Emagine-Nation.com on multiple platforms, including Mac, iPad/iPhone, and Android. Learn and play everywhere!

$750,000  The Big Enchilada! This goal will allow us to put in world animations, add additional premium features, and customized WebQuests for the top 5 contributors.  Meeting this stretch goal will turn Emagine-Nation.com from a "game-like" experience to a fully animated site.

story:
A little bio

Hi there! Thank you for visiting my campaign page.

I'm Nanae, a guitar and piano teacher at David Adler Music and Arts Center in Libertyville andThe Music Room in Palatine, Illinois. After studying at Harper College with Steve Vazquez, I received my Bachelor of Music Performance Degree from Northeastern Illinois University under the tutelage of Dr Brian Torosian. I have a wide age group of students ranging from 5 to 70 years old! When I'm not teaching, I perform at weddings and other special events. On my free time I enjoy singing, relaxing with my husband and cat, cooking, baking, exploring new food, and searching for the perfect cup of coffee :)

What's a guitar festival/ symposium/ convention?

There are guitar festivals happening all over the world every summer. It's usually a week long event that consists of competitions, lectures, masterclasses, workshops and concerts! Each one is unique in its own way, and brings in a wide variety of top class guitarists so you get a chance to meet and study with them individually and/or publicly.

Two Cities, Two Festivals

Nürtingen Guitar Festival (August 1-9)

The highlight of this festival is having the priveledge to perform with Los Angeles Guitar Quartet in the guitar orchestra piece SHIKI, written by the Japanese composer Shingo Fujii, which will premier in Europe for the first time! Plus several concerts held daily, masterclasses and technique workshops!

    Iserlohn International Guitar Symposium in Schwerte (August 10-17)

    • 16 concerts
    • More than 600 individual lessons
    • Solo, duo, ensemble
    • Four lectures
    • Guitar orchestra with Gerald Garcia (England) and Shingo Fujii (Japan)

    The Cost

    • Festival fees (includes accommodation): $2,000
    • Airfare: $1,700
    • Total: $3,700+

    That's almost $4,000 for the whole trip! My goal of $1,500 will only cover most of my plane ticket. The reason why my goal is set low is because Indiegogo will charge me 9% of what I raise if I don't reach my goal. If the goal is met, I will only be charged 4% and $1,500 sounds much more realistic than $3,700!

    Since I'll be taking time off from teaching, I'll also be losing a significant amount of income while I'm abroad. I set my goal low, but if you can help reach my ultimate goal of $3,700 it would be a miracle! Let's make it happen!

      Why is this important?

      As a musician, I strongly believe that you are never done learning. You always have room to grow. The better you become at your instrument, the more you strive to perfect your skills. The reason why it's so important for me to study in Germany is because it's this very place where classical music bloomed centuries ago. I need to know how music is perceived there today and how significant it still is in the country where so many brilliant composers were born. It's a dream for me to study in an environment much different from where I live. This is a once in a lifetime opportunity. It's something BIG that I've NEVER done before. I know it will leave a huge impact on me and it will be something that l'll remember for the rest of my life! My current and future students will benefit from this as well, as I'll come back with more knowledge than ever before! For my YouTube followers, I'll make a video of EVERYTHING that I've learned. I'll also be creating a video diary of my trip! I can't wait to bring back my experiences and stories so that I can share them with all of you!

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you aren't able to support financially, please help spread the word! Tell your friends about this campaign. Every contribution will help make a difference!

      Follow Me

      Now that I have a twitter account, I'll be able to update you guys on the campaign, my trip, and other related events! Every funder will receive a shout out on twitter so don't forget to follow @Nanaeguitar!
story_txt:
A little bio
Hi there! Thank you for visiting my campaign page. I'm Nanae, a guitar and piano teacher at David Adler Music and Arts Center in Libertyville andThe Music Room in Palatine, Illinois. After studying at Harper College with Steve Vazquez, I received my Bachelor of Music Performance Degree from Northeastern Illinois University under the tutelage of Dr Brian Torosian. I have a wide age group of students ranging from 5 to 70 years old! When I'm not teaching, I perform at weddings and other special events. On my free time I enjoy singing, relaxing with my husband and cat, cooking, baking, exploring new food, and searching for the perfect cup of coffee :)What's a guitar festival/ symposium/ convention? 
There are guitar festivals happening all over the world every summer. It's usually a week long event that consists of competitions, lectures, masterclasses, workshops and concerts! Each one is unique in its own way, and brings in a wide variety of top class guitarists so you get a chance to meet and study with them individually and/or publicly. Two Cities, Two Festivals Nürtingen Guitar Festival (August 1-9)The highlight of this festival is having the priveledge to perform with Los Angeles Guitar Quartet in the guitar orchestra piece SHIKI, written by the Japanese composer Shingo Fujii, which will premier in Europe for the first time! Plus several concerts held daily, masterclasses and technique workshops!Iserlohn International Guitar Symposium in Schwerte (August 10-17)
16 concerts
More than  600 individual lessons
Solo, duo, ensemble
Four lectures
Guitar orchestra with Gerald Garcia (England) and Shingo Fujii (Japan)
   The Cost
Festival fees (includes accommodation): $2,000
Airfare: $1,700
Total: $3,700+

That's almost $4,000 for the whole trip! My goal of $1,500 will only cover most of my plane ticket. The reason why my goal is set low is because Indiegogo will charge me 9% of what I raise if I don't reach my goal. If the goal is met, I will only be charged 4% and $1,500 sounds much more realistic than $3,700! Since I'll be taking time off from teaching, I'll also be losing a significant amount of income while I'm abroad. I set my goal low, but if you can help reach my ultimate goal of $3,700 it would be a miracle! Let's make it happen!   Why is this important?
As a musician, I strongly believe that you are never done learning. You always have room to grow. The better you become at your instrument, the more you strive to perfect your skills. The reason why it's so important for me to study in Germany is because it's this very place where classical music bloomed centuries ago. My current and future students will benefit from this as well, as I'll come back with more knowledge than ever before! For my YouTube followers, I'll make a video of EVERYTHING that I've learned. I'll also be creating a video diary of my trip! I can't wait to bring back my experiences and stories so that I can share them with all of you!
